disposition.caption: Disposition
disposition.description: The disposition name, normalized to the caption of the disposition_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

disposition_id.caption: Disposition ID
disposition_id.description: Describes the outcome or action taken by a security control, such as access control checks, malware detections or various types of policy violations.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: Granted access or allowed the action to the protected resource.

2.caption: Blocked
2.description: Denied access or blocked the action to the protected resource.

3.caption: Quarantined
3.description: A suspicious file or other content was moved to a benign location.

4.caption: Isolated
4.description: A session was isolated on the network or within a browser.

5.caption: Deleted
5.description: A file or other content was deleted.

6.caption: Dropped
6.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being dropped.

7.caption: Custom Action
7.description: A custom action was executed such as running of a command script. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

8.caption: Approved
8.description: A request or submission was approved. For example, when a form was properly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 1 'Allowed'.

9.caption: Restored
9.description: A quarantined file or other content was restored to its original location.

10.caption: Exonerated
10.description: A suspicious or risky entity was deemed to no longer be suspicious (re-scored).

11.caption: Corrected
11.description: A corrupt file or configuration was corrected.

12.caption: Partially Corrected
12.description: A corrupt file or configuration was partially corrected.

13.caption: Uncorrected
13.description: A corrupt file or configuration was not corrected.

14.caption: Delayed
14.description: An operation was delayed, for example if a restart was required to finish the operation.

15.caption: Detected
15.description: Suspicious activity or a policy violation was detected without further action.

16.caption: No Action
16.description: The outcome of an operation had no action taken.

17.caption: Logged
17.description: The operation or action was logged without further action.

18.caption: Tagged
18.description: A file or other entity was marked with extended attributes.

19.caption: Alert
19.description: The request or activity was detected as a threat and resulted in a notification but request was not blocked.

20.caption: Count
20.description: Counted the request or activity but did not determine whether to allow it or block it.

21.caption: Reset
21.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being reset.

22.caption: Captcha
22.description: Required the end user to solve a CAPTCHA puzzle to prove that a human being is sending the request.

23.caption: Challenge
23.description: Ran a silent challenge that required the client session to verify that it's a browser, and not a bot.

24.caption: Access Revoked
24.description: The requestor's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements. Note: use the Host profile if the User or Actor requestor is not present in the event class.

25.caption: Rejected
25.description: A request or submission was rejected. For example, when a form was improperly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 2 'Blocked'.

26.caption: Unauthorized
26.description: An attempt to access a resource was denied due to an authorization check that failed. This is a more specific disposition than 2 'Blocked' and can be complemented with the authorizations attribute for more detail.

27.caption: Error
27.description: An error occurred during the processing of the activity or request. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The disposition is not mapped. See the disposition attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

firewall_rule.caption: Firewall Rule
firewall_rule.description: The firewall rule that pertains to the control that triggered the event, if applicable.

is_alert.caption: Alert
is_alert.description: Indicates that the event is considered to be an alertable signal. Should be set to true if disposition_id = Alert among other dispositions, and/or risk_level_id or severity_id of the event is elevated. Not all control events will be alertable, for example if disposition_id = Exonerated or disposition_id = Allowed.

malware.caption: Malware
malware.description: A list of Malware objects, describing details about the identified malware.

policy.caption: Policy
policy.description: The policy that pertains to the control that triggered the event, if applicable. For example the name of an anti-malware policy or an access control policy.

risk_details.caption: Risk Details
risk_details.description: Describes the risk associated with the finding.

risk_level.caption: Risk Level
risk_level.description: The risk level, normalized to the caption of the risk_level_id value.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The risk level is not mapped. See the risk_level attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

risk_score.caption: Risk Score
risk_score.description: The risk score as reported by the event source.

end_time_dt.caption: End Time
end_time_dt.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

start_time_dt.caption: Start Time
start_time_dt.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

time_dt.caption: Event Time
time_dt.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

module_activity.description: Module Activity events report when a process loads or unloads the module.

process_activity.caption: Process Activity
process_activity.name: process_activity

activity_id.caption: Activity ID
activity_id.description: The normalized identifier of the activity that triggered the event.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event activity is not mapped. See the activity_name attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

actor.caption: Actor
actor.description: The actor that performed the activity on the target process. For example, the process that started a new process or injected code into another process.

actual_permissions.caption: Actual Permissions
actual_permissions.description: The permissions that were granted to the process in a platform-native format.

exit_code.caption: Exit Code
exit_code.description: The exit code reported by a process when it terminates. The convention is that zero indicates success and any non-zero exit code indicates that some error occurred.

injection_type.caption: Injection Type
injection_type.description: The process injection method, normalized to the caption of the injection_type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

injection_type_id.caption: Injection Type ID
injection_type_id.description: The normalized identifier of the process injection method.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The injection type is not mapped. See the injection_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

module.caption: Module
module.description: The module that was injected by the actor process.

process.caption: Process
process.description: The process that was launched, injected into, opened, or terminated.

requested_permissions.caption: Requested Permissions
requested_permissions.description: The permissions mask that was requested by the process.

device.caption: Device
device.description: An addressable device, computer system or host.

activity_name.caption: Activity
activity_name.description: The event activity name, as defined by the activity_id.

category_name.caption: Category
category_name.description: The event category name, as defined by category_uid value: System Activity.

category_uid.caption: Category ID
category_uid.description: The category unique identifier of the event.

1.caption: System Activity
1.description: System Activity events.

class_name.caption: Class
class_name.description: The event class name, as defined by class_uid value: Process Activity.

class_uid.caption: Class ID
class_uid.description: The unique identifier of a class. A class describes the attributes available in an event.

1007.caption: Process Activity
1007.description: Process Activity events report when a process launches, injects, opens or terminates another process, successful or otherwise.

count.caption: Count
count.description: The number of times that events in the same logical group occurred during the event Start Time to End Time period.

duration.caption: Duration Milliseconds
duration.description: The event duration or aggregate time, the amount of time the event covers from start_time to end_time in milliseconds.

end_time.caption: End Time
end_time.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

enrichments.caption: Enrichments
enrichments.description:
The additional information from an external data source, which is associated with the event or a finding. For example add location information for the IP address in the DNS answers:

[{"name": "answers.ip", "value": "92.24.47.250", "type": "location", "data": {"city": "Socotra", "continent": "Asia", "coordinates": [-25.4153, 17.0743], "country": "YE", "desc": "Yemen"}}]

message.caption: Message
message.description: The description of the event/finding, as defined by the source.

metadata.caption: Metadata
metadata.description: The metadata associated with the event or a finding.

observables.caption: Observables
observables.description: The observables associated with the event or a finding.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The event/finding severity, normalized to the caption of the severity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

severity_id.caption: Severity ID
severity_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the event/finding severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.

1.caption: Informational
1.description: Informational message. No action required.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

4.caption: High
4.description: Action is required immediately.

5.caption: Critical
5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

6.caption: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event/finding severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

start_time.caption: Start Time
start_time.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The event status, normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

status_code.caption: Status Code
status_code.description:
The event status code, as reported by the event source.

For example, in a Windows Failed Authentication event, this would be the value of 'Failure Code', e.g. 0x18.

status_detail.caption: Status Detail
status_detail.description: The status detail contains additional information about the event/finding outcome.

status_id.caption: Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized identifier of the event status.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

time.caption: Event Time
time.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

timezone_offset.caption: Timezone Offset
timezone_offset.description: The number of minutes that the reported event time is ahead or behind UTC, in the range -1,080 to +1,080.

type_name.caption: Type Name
type_name.description: The event/finding type name, as defined by the type_uid.

type_uid.caption: Type ID
type_uid.description: The event/finding type ID. It identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_uid * 100 + activity_id.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

api.caption: API Details
api.description: Describes details about a typical API (Application Programming Interface) call.

cloud.caption: Cloud
cloud.description: Describes details about the Cloud environment where the event was originally created or logged.

osint.caption: OSINT
osint.description: The OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) object contains details related to an indicator such as the indicator itself, related indicators, geolocation, registrar information, subdomains, analyst commentary, and other contextual information. This information can be used to further enrich a detection or finding by providing decisioning support to other analysts and engineers.

action_id.caption: Action ID
action_id.description: The action taken by a control or other policy-based system leading to an outcome or disposition. An unknown action may still correspond to a known disposition. Refer to disposition_id for the outcome of the action.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The action was unknown. The disposition_id attribute may still be set to a non-unknown value, for example 'Custom Action', 'Challenge'.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: The activity was allowed. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Allowed', 'Approved', 'Delayed', 'No Action', 'Count' etc.

2.caption: Denied
2.description: The attempted activity was denied. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Blocked', 'Rejected', 'Quarantined', 'Isolated', 'Dropped', 'Access Revoked, etc.

3.caption: Observed
3.description: The activity was observed, but neither explicitly allowed nor denied. This is common with IDS and EDR controls that report additional information on observed behavior such as TTPs. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Logged', 'Alert', 'Detected', 'Count', etc.

4.caption: Modified
4.description: The activity was modified, adjusted, or corrected. The disposition_id attribute should be set appropriately, for example 'Restored', 'Corrected', 'Delayed', 'Captcha', 'Tagged'.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The action is not mapped. See the action attribute which contains a data source specific value.

attacks.caption: MITRE ATT&CK® Details
attacks.description: An array of MITRE ATT&CK® objects describing identified tactics, techniques & sub-techniques.

authorizations.caption: Authorization Information
authorizations.description: Provides details about an authorization, such as authorization outcome, and any associated policies related to the activity/event.

confidence.caption: Confidence
confidence.description: The confidence, normalized to the caption of the confidence_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

confidence_id.caption: Confidence ID
confidence_id.description: The normalized confidence refers to the accuracy of the rule that created the finding. A rule with a low confidence means that the finding scope is wide and may create finding reports that may not be malicious in nature.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The confidence is not mapped to the defined enum values. See the confidence attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

confidence_score.caption: Confidence Score
confidence_score.description: The confidence score as reported by the event source.

attacks.caption: MITRE ATT&CK® Details
attacks.description: An array of MITRE ATT&CK® objects describing identified tactics, techniques & sub-techniques.

authorizations.caption: Authorization Information
authorizations.description: Provides details about an authorization, such as authorization outcome, and any associated policies related to the activity/event.

confidence.caption: Confidence
confidence.description: The confidence, normalized to the caption of the confidence_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

confidence_id.caption: Confidence ID
confidence_id.description: The normalized confidence refers to the accuracy of the rule that created the finding. A rule with a low confidence means that the finding scope is wide and may create finding reports that may not be malicious in nature.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The confidence is not mapped to the defined enum values. See the confidence attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

confidence_score.caption: Confidence Score
confidence_score.description: The confidence score as reported by the event source.

disposition.caption: Disposition
disposition.description: The disposition name, normalized to the caption of the disposition_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

disposition_id.caption: Disposition ID
disposition_id.description: Describes the outcome or action taken by a security control, such as access control checks, malware detections or various types of policy violations.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: Granted access or allowed the action to the protected resource.

2.caption: Blocked
2.description: Denied access or blocked the action to the protected resource.

3.caption: Quarantined
3.description: A suspicious file or other content was moved to a benign location.

4.caption: Isolated
4.description: A session was isolated on the network or within a browser.

5.caption: Deleted
5.description: A file or other content was deleted.

6.caption: Dropped
6.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being dropped.

7.caption: Custom Action
7.description: A custom action was executed such as running of a command script. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

8.caption: Approved
8.description: A request or submission was approved. For example, when a form was properly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 1 'Allowed'.

9.caption: Restored
9.description: A quarantined file or other content was restored to its original location.

10.caption: Exonerated
10.description: A suspicious or risky entity was deemed to no longer be suspicious (re-scored).

11.caption: Corrected
11.description: A corrupt file or configuration was corrected.

12.caption: Partially Corrected
12.description: A corrupt file or configuration was partially corrected.

13.caption: Uncorrected
13.description: A corrupt file or configuration was not corrected.

14.caption: Delayed
14.description: An operation was delayed, for example if a restart was required to finish the operation.

15.caption: Detected
15.description: Suspicious activity or a policy violation was detected without further action.

16.caption: No Action
16.description: The outcome of an operation had no action taken.

17.caption: Logged
17.description: The operation or action was logged without further action.

18.caption: Tagged
18.description: A file or other entity was marked with extended attributes.

19.caption: Alert
19.description: The request or activity was detected as a threat and resulted in a notification but request was not blocked.

20.caption: Count
20.description: Counted the request or activity but did not determine whether to allow it or block it.

21.caption: Reset
21.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being reset.

22.caption: Captcha
22.description: Required the end user to solve a CAPTCHA puzzle to prove that a human being is sending the request.

23.caption: Challenge
23.description: Ran a silent challenge that required the client session to verify that it's a browser, and not a bot.

24.caption: Access Revoked
24.description: The requestor's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements. Note: use the Host profile if the User or Actor requestor is not present in the event class.

25.caption: Rejected
25.description: A request or submission was rejected. For example, when a form was improperly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 2 'Blocked'.

26.caption: Unauthorized
26.description: An attempt to access a resource was denied due to an authorization check that failed. This is a more specific disposition than 2 'Blocked' and can be complemented with the authorizations attribute for more detail.

27.caption: Error
27.description: An error occurred during the processing of the activity or request. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The disposition is not mapped. See the disposition attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

firewall_rule.caption: Firewall Rule
firewall_rule.description: The firewall rule that pertains to the control that triggered the event, if applicable.

is_alert.caption: Alert
is_alert.description: Indicates that the event is considered to be an alertable signal. Should be set to true if disposition_id = Alert among other dispositions, and/or risk_level_id or severity_id of the event is elevated. Not all control events will be alertable, for example if disposition_id = Exonerated or disposition_id = Allowed.

malware.caption: Malware
malware.description: A list of Malware objects, describing details about the identified malware.

policy.caption: Policy
policy.description: The policy that pertains to the control that triggered the event, if applicable. For example the name of an anti-malware policy or an access control policy.

risk_details.caption: Risk Details
risk_details.description: Describes the risk associated with the finding.

risk_level.caption: Risk Level
risk_level.description: The risk level, normalized to the caption of the risk_level_id value.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The risk level is not mapped. See the risk_level attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

risk_score.caption: Risk Score
risk_score.description: The risk score as reported by the event source.

end_time_dt.caption: End Time
end_time_dt.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

start_time_dt.caption: Start Time
start_time_dt.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

time_dt.caption: Event Time
time_dt.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

event_log_actvity.description: Event Log Activity events report actions pertaining to the system's event logging service(s), such as disabling logging or clearing the log data.

script_activity.caption: Script Activity
script_activity.name: script_activity

activity_id.caption: Activity ID
activity_id.description: The normalized identifier of the activity that triggered the event.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event activity is not mapped. See the activity_name attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

script.caption: Script
script.description: The script that was the target of the activity.

actor.caption: Actor
actor.description: The actor object describes details about the user/role/process that was the source of the activity. Note that this is not the threat actor of a campaign but may be part of a campaign.

device.caption: Device
device.description: An addressable device, computer system or host.

activity_name.caption: Activity
activity_name.description: The event activity name, as defined by the activity_id.

category_name.caption: Category
category_name.description: The event category name, as defined by category_uid value: System Activity.

category_uid.caption: Category ID
category_uid.description: The category unique identifier of the event.

1.caption: System Activity
1.description: System Activity events.

class_name.caption: Class
class_name.description: The event class name, as defined by class_uid value: Script Activity.

class_uid.caption: Class ID
class_uid.description: The unique identifier of a class. A class describes the attributes available in an event.

1009.caption: Script Activity
1009.description: Script Activity events report when a process executes a script.

count.caption: Count
count.description: The number of times that events in the same logical group occurred during the event Start Time to End Time period.

duration.caption: Duration Milliseconds
duration.description: The event duration or aggregate time, the amount of time the event covers from start_time to end_time in milliseconds.

end_time.caption: End Time
end_time.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

enrichments.caption: Enrichments
enrichments.description:
The additional information from an external data source, which is associated with the event or a finding. For example add location information for the IP address in the DNS answers:

[{"name": "answers.ip", "value": "92.24.47.250", "type": "location", "data": {"city": "Socotra", "continent": "Asia", "coordinates": [-25.4153, 17.0743], "country": "YE", "desc": "Yemen"}}]

message.caption: Message
message.description: The description of the event/finding, as defined by the source.

metadata.caption: Metadata
metadata.description: The metadata associated with the event or a finding.

observables.caption: Observables
observables.description: The observables associated with the event or a finding.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The event/finding severity, normalized to the caption of the severity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

severity_id.caption: Severity ID
severity_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the event/finding severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.

1.caption: Informational
1.description: Informational message. No action required.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

4.caption: High
4.description: Action is required immediately.

5.caption: Critical
5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

6.caption: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event/finding severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

start_time.caption: Start Time
start_time.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The event status, normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

status_code.caption: Status Code
status_code.description:
The event status code, as reported by the event source.

For example, in a Windows Failed Authentication event, this would be the value of 'Failure Code', e.g. 0x18.

status_detail.caption: Status Detail
status_detail.description: The status detail contains additional information about the event/finding outcome.

status_id.caption: Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized identifier of the event status.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

time.caption: Event Time
time.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

timezone_offset.caption: Timezone Offset
timezone_offset.description: The number of minutes that the reported event time is ahead or behind UTC, in the range -1,080 to +1,080.

type_name.caption: Type Name
type_name.description: The event/finding type name, as defined by the type_uid.

type_uid.caption: Type ID
type_uid.description: The event/finding type ID. It identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_uid * 100 + activity_id.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

api.caption: API Details
api.description: Describes details about a typical API (Application Programming Interface) call.

cloud.caption: Cloud
cloud.description: Describes details about the Cloud environment where the event was originally created or logged.

osint.caption: OSINT
osint.description: The OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) object contains details related to an indicator such as the indicator itself, related indicators, geolocation, registrar information, subdomains, analyst commentary, and other contextual information. This information can be used to further enrich a detection or finding by providing decisioning support to other analysts and engineers.

action_id.caption: Action ID
action_id.description: The action taken by a control or other policy-based system leading to an outcome or disposition. An unknown action may still correspond to a known disposition. Refer to disposition_id for the outcome of the action.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The action was unknown. The disposition_id attribute may still be set to a non-unknown value, for example 'Custom Action', 'Challenge'.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: The activity was allowed. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Allowed', 'Approved', 'Delayed', 'No Action', 'Count' etc.

2.caption: Denied
2.description: The attempted activity was denied. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Blocked', 'Rejected', 'Quarantined', 'Isolated', 'Dropped', 'Access Revoked, etc.

3.caption: Observed
3.description: The activity was observed, but neither explicitly allowed nor denied. This is common with IDS and EDR controls that report additional information on observed behavior such as TTPs. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Logged', 'Alert', 'Detected', 'Count', etc.

4.caption: Modified
4.description: The activity was modified, adjusted, or corrected. The disposition_id attribute should be set appropriately, for example 'Restored', 'Corrected', 'Delayed', 'Captcha', 'Tagged'.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The action is not mapped. See the action attribute which contains a data source specific value.

13.description: A corrupt file or configuration was not corrected.

14.caption: Delayed
14.description: An operation was delayed, for example if a restart was required to finish the operation.

15.caption: Detected
15.description: Suspicious activity or a policy violation was detected without further action.

16.caption: No Action
16.description: The outcome of an operation had no action taken.

17.caption: Logged
17.description: The operation or action was logged without further action.

18.caption: Tagged
18.description: A file or other entity was marked with extended attributes.

19.caption: Alert
19.description: The request or activity was detected as a threat and resulted in a notification but request was not blocked.

20.caption: Count
20.description: Counted the request or activity but did not determine whether to allow it or block it.

21.caption: Reset
21.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being reset.

22.caption: Captcha
22.description: Required the end user to solve a CAPTCHA puzzle to prove that a human being is sending the request.

23.caption: Challenge
23.description: Ran a silent challenge that required the client session to verify that it's a browser, and not a bot.

24.caption: Access Revoked
24.description: The requestor's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements. Note: use the Host profile if the User or Actor requestor is not present in the event class.

25.caption: Rejected
25.description: A request or submission was rejected. For example, when a form was improperly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 2 'Blocked'.

26.caption: Unauthorized
26.description: An attempt to access a resource was denied due to an authorization check that failed. This is a more specific disposition than 2 'Blocked' and can be complemented with the authorizations attribute for more detail.

27.caption: Error
27.description: An error occurred during the processing of the activity or request. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The disposition is not mapped. See the disposition attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

firewall_rule.caption: Firewall Rule
firewall_rule.description: The firewall rule that pertains to the control that triggered the event, if applicable.

is_alert.caption: Alert
is_alert.description: Indicates that the event is considered to be an alertable signal. Should be set to true if disposition_id = Alert among other dispositions, and/or risk_level_id or severity_id of the event is elevated. Not all control events will be alertable, for example if disposition_id = Exonerated or disposition_id = Allowed.

malware.caption: Malware
malware.description: A list of Malware objects, describing details about the identified malware.

policy.caption: Policy
policy.description: The policy that pertains to the control that triggered the event, if applicable. For example the name of an anti-malware policy or an access control policy.

risk_details.caption: Risk Details
risk_details.description: Describes the risk associated with the finding.

risk_level.caption: Risk Level
risk_level.description: The risk level, normalized to the caption of the risk_level_id value.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The risk level is not mapped. See the risk_level attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

risk_score.caption: Risk Score
risk_score.description: The risk score as reported by the event source.

end_time_dt.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

start_time_dt.caption: Start Time
start_time_dt.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

time_dt.caption: Event Time
time_dt.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

2.caption: Revoke Privileges
2.description: Revoke privileges from a user.

99.caption: Other

privileges.description: List of privileges assigned to a user.

resource.caption: Resource
resource.description: Resource that the privileges give access to.

user.caption: User
user.description: User to which privileges were assigned.

actor.caption: Actor
actor.description: The actor object describes details about the user/role/process that was the source of the activity. Note that this is not the threat actor of a campaign but may be part of a campaign.

http_request.caption: HTTP Request
http_request.description: Details about the underlying HTTP request.

http_response.caption: HTTP Response
http_response.description: Details about the underlying HTTP response.

src_endpoint.caption: Source Endpoint
src_endpoint.description: Details about the source of the IAM activity.

activity_name.caption: Activity
activity_name.description: The event activity name, as defined by the activity_id.

category_name.caption: Category
category_name.description: The event category name, as defined by category_uid value: Identity & Access Management.

category_uid.caption: Category ID
category_uid.description: The category unique identifier of the event.

3.caption: Identity & Access Management
3.description: Identity & Access Management (IAM) events relate to the supervision of the system's authentication and access control model. Examples of such events are the success or failure of authentication, granting of authority, password change, entity change, privileged use etc.

class_name.caption: Class
class_name.description: The event class name, as defined by class_uid value: User Access Management.

class_uid.caption: Class ID
class_uid.description: The unique identifier of a class. A class describes the attributes available in an event.

3005.caption: User Access Management
3005.description: User Access Management events report management updates to a user's privileges.

count.caption: Count
count.description: The number of times that events in the same logical group occurred during the event Start Time to End Time period.

duration.caption: Duration Milliseconds
duration.description: The event duration or aggregate time, the amount of time the event covers from start_time to end_time in milliseconds.

end_time.caption: End Time
end_time.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

enrichments.caption: Enrichments
enrichments.description:
The additional information from an external data source, which is associated with the event or a finding. For example add location information for the IP address in the DNS answers:

[{"name": "answers.ip", "value": "92.24.47.250", "type": "location", "data": {"city": "Socotra", "continent": "Asia", "coordinates": [-25.4153, 17.0743], "country": "YE", "desc": "Yemen"}}]

message.caption: Message
message.description: The description of the event/finding, as defined by the source.

metadata.caption: Metadata
metadata.description: The metadata associated with the event or a finding.

observables.caption: Observables
observables.description: The observables associated with the event or a finding.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The event/finding severity, normalized to the caption of the severity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

severity_id.caption: Severity ID
severity_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the event/finding severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.

1.caption: Informational
1.description: Informational message. No action required.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

4.caption: High
4.description: Action is required immediately.

5.caption: Critical
5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

6.caption: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event/finding severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

start_time.caption: Start Time
start_time.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The event status, normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

status_code.caption: Status Code
status_code.description:
The event status code, as reported by the event source.

For example, in a Windows Failed Authentication event, this would be the value of 'Failure Code', e.g. 0x18.

status_detail.caption: Status Detail
status_detail.description: The status detail contains additional information about the event/finding outcome.

status_id.caption: Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized identifier of the event status.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

time.caption: Event Time
time.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

timezone_offset.caption: Timezone Offset
timezone_offset.description: The number of minutes that the reported event time is ahead or behind UTC, in the range -1,080 to +1,080.

type_name.caption: Type Name
type_name.description: The event/finding type name, as defined by the type_uid.

type_uid.caption: Type ID
type_uid.description: The event/finding type ID. It identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_uid * 100 + activity_id.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

api.caption: API Details
api.description: Describes details about a typical API (Application Programming Interface) call.

cloud.caption: Cloud
cloud.description: Describes details about the Cloud environment where the event was originally created or logged.

device.caption: Device
device.description: An addressable device, computer system or host.

osint.caption: OSINT
osint.description: The OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) object contains details related to an indicator such as the indicator itself, related indicators, geolocation, registrar information, subdomains, analyst commentary, and other contextual information. This information can be used to further enrich a detection or finding by providing decisioning support to other analysts and engineers.

action_id.caption: Action ID
action_id.description: The action taken by a control or other policy-based system leading to an outcome or disposition. An unknown action may still correspond to a known disposition. Refer to disposition_id for the outcome of the action.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The action was unknown. The disposition_id attribute may still be set to a non-unknown value, for example 'Custom Action', 'Challenge'.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: The activity was allowed. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Allowed', 'Approved', 'Delayed', 'No Action', 'Count' etc.

2.caption: Denied
2.description: The attempted activity was denied. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Blocked', 'Rejected', 'Quarantined', 'Isolated', 'Dropped', 'Access Revoked, etc.

3.caption: Observed
3.description: The activity was observed, but neither explicitly allowed nor denied. This is common with IDS and EDR controls that report additional information on observed behavior such as TTPs. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Logged', 'Alert', 'Detected', 'Count', etc.

4.caption: Modified
4.description: The activity was modified, adjusted, or corrected. The disposition_id attribute should be set appropriately, for example 'Restored', 'Corrected', 'Delayed', 'Captcha', 'Tagged'.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The action is not mapped. See the action attribute which contains a data source specific value.

attacks.caption: MITRE ATT&CK® Details
attacks.description: An array of MITRE ATT&CK® objects describing identified tactics, techniques & sub-techniques.

authorizations.caption: Authorization Information
authorizations.description: Provides details about an authorization, such as authorization outcome, and any associated policies related to the activity/event.

confidence.caption: Confidence
confidence.description: The confidence, normalized to the caption of the confidence_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

confidence_id.caption: Confidence ID
confidence_id.description: The normalized confidence refers to the accuracy of the rule that created the finding. A rule with a low confidence means that the finding scope is wide and may create finding reports that may not be malicious in nature.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The confidence is not mapped to the defined enum values. See the confidence attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

confidence_score.caption: Confidence Score
confidence_score.description: The confidence score as reported by the event source.

disposition.caption: Disposition
disposition.description: The disposition name, normalized to the caption of the disposition_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

disposition_id.caption: Disposition ID
disposition_id.description: Describes the outcome or action taken by a security control, such as access control checks, malware detections or various types of policy violations.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: Granted access or allowed the action to the protected resource.

2.caption: Blocked
2.description: Denied access or blocked the action to the protected resource.

3.caption: Quarantined
3.description: A suspicious file or other content was moved to a benign location.

4.caption: Isolated
4.description: A session was isolated on the network or within a browser.

5.caption: Deleted
5.description: A file or other content was deleted.

6.caption: Dropped
6.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being dropped.

7.caption: Custom Action
7.description: A custom action was executed such as running of a command script. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

8.caption: Approved
8.description: A request or submission was approved. For example, when a form was properly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 1 'Allowed'.

9.caption: Restored
9.description: A quarantined file or other content was restored to its original location.

10.caption: Exonerated
10.description: A suspicious or risky entity was deemed to no longer be suspicious (re-scored).

11.caption: Corrected
11.description: A corrupt file or configuration was corrected.

12.caption: Partially Corrected
12.description: A corrupt file or configuration was partially corrected.

13.caption: Uncorrected
13.description: A corrupt file or configuration was not corrected.

14.caption: Delayed
14.description: An operation was delayed, for example if a restart was required to finish the operation.

15.caption: Detected
15.description: Suspicious activity or a policy violation was detected without further action.

16.caption: No Action
16.description: The outcome of an operation had no action taken.

17.caption: Logged
17.description: The operation or action was logged without further action.

18.caption: Tagged
18.description: A file or other entity was marked with extended attributes.

19.caption: Alert
19.description: The request or activity was detected as a threat and resulted in a notification but request was not blocked.

20.caption: Count
20.description: Counted the request or activity but did not determine whether to allow it or block it.

21.caption: Reset

22.caption: Captcha
22.description: Required the end user to solve a CAPTCHA puzzle to prove that a human being is sending the request.

23.caption: Challenge
23.description: Ran a silent challenge that required the client session to verify that it's a browser, and not a bot.

24.caption: Access Revoked
24.description: The requestor's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements. Note: use the Host profile if the User or Actor requestor is not present in the event class.

25.caption: Rejected
25.description: A request or submission was rejected. For example, when a form was improperly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 2 'Blocked'.

26.caption: Unauthorized
26.description: An attempt to access a resource was denied due to an authorization check that failed. This is a more specific disposition than 2 'Blocked' and can be complemented with the authorizations attribute for more detail.

27.caption: Error
27.description: An error occurred during the processing of the activity or request. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The disposition is not mapped. See the disposition attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

3.description: A suspicious file or other content was moved to a benign location.

4.caption: Isolated
4.description: A session was isolated on the network or within a browser.

5.caption: Deleted
5.description: A file or other content was deleted.

6.caption: Dropped
6.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being dropped.

7.caption: Custom Action
7.description: A custom action was executed such as running of a command script. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

8.caption: Approved
8.description: A request or submission was approved. For example, when a form was properly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 1 'Allowed'.

9.caption: Restored
9.description: A quarantined file or other content was restored to its original location.

10.caption: Exonerated
10.description: A suspicious or risky entity was deemed to no longer be suspicious (re-scored).

11.caption: Corrected
11.description: A corrupt file or configuration was corrected.

12.caption: Partially Corrected
12.description: A corrupt file or configuration was partially corrected.

13.caption: Uncorrected
13.description: A corrupt file or configuration was not corrected.

14.caption: Delayed
14.description: An operation was delayed, for example if a restart was required to finish the operation.

15.caption: Detected
15.description: Suspicious activity or a policy violation was detected without further action.

16.caption: No Action
16.description: The outcome of an operation had no action taken.

17.caption: Logged
17.description: The operation or action was logged without further action.

18.caption: Tagged
18.description: A file or other entity was marked with extended attributes.

19.caption: Alert
19.description: The request or activity was detected as a threat and resulted in a notification but request was not blocked.

20.caption: Count
20.description: Counted the request or activity but did not determine whether to allow it or block it.

21.caption: Reset
21.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being reset.

22.caption: Captcha
22.description: Required the end user to solve a CAPTCHA puzzle to prove that a human being is sending the request.

23.caption: Challenge
23.description: Ran a silent challenge that required the client session to verify that it's a browser, and not a bot.

24.caption: Access Revoked
24.description: The requestor's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements. Note: use the Host profile if the User or Actor requestor is not present in the event class.

25.caption: Rejected
25.description: A request or submission was rejected. For example, when a form was improperly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 2 'Blocked'.

26.caption: Unauthorized
26.description: An attempt to access a resource was denied due to an authorization check that failed. This is a more specific disposition than 2 'Blocked' and can be complemented with the authorizations attribute for more detail.

27.caption: Error
27.description: An error occurred during the processing of the activity or request. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The disposition is not mapped. See the disposition attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

firewall_rule.caption: Firewall Rule
firewall_rule.description: The firewall rule that pertains to the control that triggered the event, if applicable.

is_alert.caption: Alert
is_alert.description: Indicates that the event is considered to be an alertable signal. Should be set to true if disposition_id = Alert among other dispositions, and/or risk_level_id or severity_id of the event is elevated. Not all control events will be alertable, for example if disposition_id = Exonerated or disposition_id = Allowed.

malware.caption: Malware
malware.description: A list of Malware objects, describing details about the identified malware.

risk_details.caption: Risk Details
risk_details.description: Describes the risk associated with the finding.

risk_level.caption: Risk Level
risk_level.description: The risk level, normalized to the caption of the risk_level_id value.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The risk level is not mapped. See the risk_level attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

risk_score.caption: Risk Score
risk_score.description: The risk score as reported by the event source.

end_time_dt.caption: End Time
end_time_dt.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

start_time_dt.caption: Start Time
start_time_dt.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

time_dt.caption: Event Time
time_dt.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

account_change.description: Account Change events report when specific user account management tasks are performed, such as a user/role being created, changed, deleted, renamed, disabled, enabled, locked out or unlocked.

authentication.caption: Authentication
authentication.name: authentication

activity_id.caption: Activity ID
activity_id.description: The normalized identifier of the activity that triggered the event.

1.caption: Logon
1.description: A new logon session was requested.

2.caption: Logoff
2.description: A logon session was terminated and no longer exists.

3.caption: Authentication Ticket
3.description: A Kerberos authentication ticket (TGT) was requested.

4.caption: Service Ticket Request
4.description: A Kerberos service ticket was requested.

5.caption: Service Ticket Renew
5.description: A Kerberos service ticket was renewed.

6.caption: Preauth
6.description: A preauthentication stage was engaged.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event activity is not mapped. See the activity_name attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

auth_factors.caption: Authentication Factors
auth_factors.description: Describes a category of methods used for identity verification in an authentication attempt.

auth_protocol.caption: Auth Protocol
auth_protocol.description: The authentication protocol as defined by the caption of auth_protocol_id. In the case of Other, it is defined by the event source.

auth_protocol_id.caption: Auth Protocol ID
auth_protocol_id.description: The normalized identifier of the authentication protocol used to create the user session.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The authentication protocol is not mapped. See the auth_protocol attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

certificate.caption: Certificate
certificate.description: The certificate associated with the authentication or pre-authentication (Kerberos).

dst_endpoint.caption: Destination Endpoint
dst_endpoint.description: The endpoint to which the authentication was targeted.

is_cleartext.caption: Cleartext Credentials
is_cleartext.description:
Indicates whether the credentials were passed in clear text.

Note: True if the credentials were passed in a clear text protocol such as FTP or TELNET, or if Windows detected that a user's logon password was passed to the authentication package in clear text.

is_mfa.caption: Multi Factor Authentication
is_mfa.description: Indicates whether Multi Factor Authentication was used during authentication.

is_new_logon.caption: New Logon
is_new_logon.description: Indicates logon is from a device not seen before or a first time account logon.

is_remote.caption: Remote
is_remote.description: The attempted authentication is over a remote connection.

logon_process.caption: Logon Process
logon_process.description: The trusted process that validated the authentication credentials.

logon_type.caption: Logon Type
logon_type.description: The logon type, normalized to the caption of the logon_type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

1.caption: System
1.description: Used only by the System account, for example at system startup.

2.caption: Interactive
2.description: A local logon to device console.

3.caption: Network
3.description: A user or device logged onto this device from the network.

4.caption: Batch
4.description: A batch server logon, where processes may be executing on behalf of a user without their direct intervention.

5.caption: OS Service
5.description: A logon by a service or daemon that was started by the OS.

7.caption: Unlock
7.description: A user unlocked the device.

8.caption: Network Cleartext
8.description: A user logged on to this device from the network. The user's password in the authentication package was not hashed.

9.caption: New Credentials
9.description: A caller cloned its current token and specified new credentials for outbound connections. The new logon session has the same local identity, but uses different credentials for other network connections.

10.caption: Remote Interactive
10.description: A remote logon using Terminal Services or remote desktop application.

11.caption: Cached Interactive
11.description: A user logged on to this device with network credentials that were stored locally on the device and the domain controller was not contacted to verify the credentials.

12.caption: Cached Remote Interactive
12.description: Same as Remote Interactive. This is used for internal auditing.

13.caption: Cached Unlock
13.description: Workstation logon.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The logon type is not mapped. See the logon_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

service.caption: Service
service.description: The service or gateway to which the user or process is being authenticated

session.caption: Session
session.description: The authenticated user or service session.

status_detail.caption: Status Detail
status_detail.description:
The details about the authentication request. For example, possible details for Windows logon or logoff events are:
  • Success
    • LOGOFF_USER_INITIATED
    • LOGOFF_OTHER
  • Failure
    • USER_DOES_NOT_EXIST
    • INVALID_CREDENTIALS
    • ACCOUNT_DISABLED
    • ACCOUNT_LOCKED_OUT
    • PASSWORD_EXPIRED

user.caption: User
user.description: The subject (user/role or account) to authenticate.

actor.caption: Actor
actor.description: The actor object describes details about the user/role/process that was the source of the activity. Note that this is not the threat actor of a campaign but may be part of a campaign.

http_request.caption: HTTP Request
http_request.description: Details about the underlying HTTP request.

http_response.caption: HTTP Response
http_response.description: Details about the underlying HTTP response.

src_endpoint.caption: Source Endpoint
src_endpoint.description: Details about the source of the IAM activity.

activity_name.caption: Activity
activity_name.description: The event activity name, as defined by the activity_id.

category_name.caption: Category
category_name.description: The event category name, as defined by category_uid value: Identity & Access Management.

category_uid.caption: Category ID
category_uid.description: The category unique identifier of the event.

3.caption: Identity & Access Management
3.description: Identity & Access Management (IAM) events relate to the supervision of the system's authentication and access control model. Examples of such events are the success or failure of authentication, granting of authority, password change, entity change, privileged use etc.

class_name.caption: Class
class_name.description: The event class name, as defined by class_uid value: Authentication.

class_uid.caption: Class ID
class_uid.description: The unique identifier of a class. A class describes the attributes available in an event.

3002.caption: Authentication
3002.description: Authentication events report authentication session activities such as user attempts a logon or logoff, successfully or otherwise.

count.caption: Count
count.description: The number of times that events in the same logical group occurred during the event Start Time to End Time period.

duration.caption: Duration Milliseconds
duration.description: The event duration or aggregate time, the amount of time the event covers from start_time to end_time in milliseconds.

end_time.caption: End Time
end_time.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

enrichments.caption: Enrichments
enrichments.description:
The additional information from an external data source, which is associated with the event or a finding. For example add location information for the IP address in the DNS answers:

[{"name": "answers.ip", "value": "92.24.47.250", "type": "location", "data": {"city": "Socotra", "continent": "Asia", "coordinates": [-25.4153, 17.0743], "country": "YE", "desc": "Yemen"}}]

message.caption: Message
message.description: The description of the event/finding, as defined by the source.

metadata.caption: Metadata
metadata.description: The metadata associated with the event or a finding.

observables.caption: Observables
observables.description: The observables associated with the event or a finding.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The event/finding severity, normalized to the caption of the severity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

severity_id.caption: Severity ID
severity_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the event/finding severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.

1.caption: Informational
1.description: Informational message. No action required.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

4.caption: High
4.description: Action is required immediately.

5.caption: Critical
5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

6.caption: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event/finding severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

start_time.caption: Start Time
start_time.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The event status, normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

status_code.caption: Status Code
status_code.description:
The event status code, as reported by the event source.

For example, in a Windows Failed Authentication event, this would be the value of 'Failure Code', e.g. 0x18.

status_id.caption: Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized identifier of the event status.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

time.caption: Event Time
time.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

timezone_offset.caption: Timezone Offset
timezone_offset.description: The number of minutes that the reported event time is ahead or behind UTC, in the range -1,080 to +1,080.

type_name.caption: Type Name
type_name.description: The event/finding type name, as defined by the type_uid.

type_uid.caption: Type ID
type_uid.description: The event/finding type ID. It identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_uid * 100 + activity_id.

300201.caption: Authentication: Logon
300201.description: A new logon session was requested.

300202.caption: Authentication: Logoff
300202.description: A logon session was terminated and no longer exists.

300203.caption: Authentication: Authentication Ticket
300203.description: A Kerberos authentication ticket (TGT) was requested.

300204.caption: Authentication: Service Ticket Request
300204.description: A Kerberos service ticket was requested.

300205.caption: Authentication: Service Ticket Renew
300205.description: A Kerberos service ticket was renewed.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

api.caption: API Details
api.description: Describes details about a typical API (Application Programming Interface) call.

cloud.caption: Cloud
cloud.description: Describes details about the Cloud environment where the event was originally created or logged.

device.caption: Device
device.description: An addressable device, computer system or host.

osint.caption: OSINT
osint.description: The OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) object contains details related to an indicator such as the indicator itself, related indicators, geolocation, registrar information, subdomains, analyst commentary, and other contextual information. This information can be used to further enrich a detection or finding by providing decisioning support to other analysts and engineers.

action_id.caption: Action ID
action_id.description: The action taken by a control or other policy-based system leading to an outcome or disposition. An unknown action may still correspond to a known disposition. Refer to disposition_id for the outcome of the action.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The action was unknown. The disposition_id attribute may still be set to a non-unknown value, for example 'Custom Action', 'Challenge'.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: The activity was allowed. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Allowed', 'Approved', 'Delayed', 'No Action', 'Count' etc.

2.caption: Denied
2.description: The attempted activity was denied. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Blocked', 'Rejected', 'Quarantined', 'Isolated', 'Dropped', 'Access Revoked, etc.

3.caption: Observed
3.description: The activity was observed, but neither explicitly allowed nor denied. This is common with IDS and EDR controls that report additional information on observed behavior such as TTPs. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Logged', 'Alert', 'Detected', 'Count', etc.

4.caption: Modified
4.description: The activity was modified, adjusted, or corrected. The disposition_id attribute should be set appropriately, for example 'Restored', 'Corrected', 'Delayed', 'Captcha', 'Tagged'.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The action is not mapped. See the action attribute which contains a data source specific value.

attacks.caption: MITRE ATT&CK® Details
attacks.description: An array of MITRE ATT&CK® objects describing identified tactics, techniques & sub-techniques.

authorizations.caption: Authorization Information
authorizations.description: Provides details about an authorization, such as authorization outcome, and any associated policies related to the activity/event.

confidence.caption: Confidence
confidence.description: The confidence, normalized to the caption of the confidence_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

confidence_id.caption: Confidence ID
confidence_id.description: The normalized confidence refers to the accuracy of the rule that created the finding. A rule with a low confidence means that the finding scope is wide and may create finding reports that may not be malicious in nature.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The confidence is not mapped to the defined enum values. See the confidence attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

confidence_score.caption: Confidence Score
confidence_score.description: The confidence score as reported by the event source.

disposition.caption: Disposition
disposition.description: The disposition name, normalized to the caption of the disposition_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

disposition_id.caption: Disposition ID
disposition_id.description: Describes the outcome or action taken by a security control, such as access control checks, malware detections or various types of policy violations.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: Granted access or allowed the action to the protected resource.

2.caption: Blocked
2.description: Denied access or blocked the action to the protected resource.

3.caption: Quarantined
3.description: A suspicious file or other content was moved to a benign location.

4.caption: Isolated
4.description: A session was isolated on the network or within a browser.

5.caption: Deleted
5.description: A file or other content was deleted.

6.caption: Dropped
6.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being dropped.

7.caption: Custom Action
7.description: A custom action was executed such as running of a command script. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

8.caption: Approved
8.description: A request or submission was approved. For example, when a form was properly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 1 'Allowed'.

9.caption: Restored
9.description: A quarantined file or other content was restored to its original location.

10.caption: Exonerated
10.description: A suspicious or risky entity was deemed to no longer be suspicious (re-scored).

11.caption: Corrected
11.description: A corrupt file or configuration was corrected.

12.caption: Partially Corrected
12.description: A corrupt file or configuration was partially corrected.

13.caption: Uncorrected
13.description: A corrupt file or configuration was not corrected.

14.caption: Delayed
14.description: An operation was delayed, for example if a restart was required to finish the operation.

15.caption: Detected
15.description: Suspicious activity or a policy violation was detected without further action.

16.caption: No Action
16.description: The outcome of an operation had no action taken.

17.caption: Logged
17.description: The operation or action was logged without further action.

18.caption: Tagged
18.description: A file or other entity was marked with extended attributes.

19.caption: Alert
19.description: The request or activity was detected as a threat and resulted in a notification but request was not blocked.

20.caption: Count
20.description: Counted the request or activity but did not determine whether to allow it or block it.

21.caption: Reset
21.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being reset.

22.caption: Captcha
22.description: Required the end user to solve a CAPTCHA puzzle to prove that a human being is sending the request.

23.caption: Challenge
23.description: Ran a silent challenge that required the client session to verify that it's a browser, and not a bot.

24.caption: Access Revoked
24.description: The requestor's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements. Note: use the Host profile if the User or Actor requestor is not present in the event class.

25.caption: Rejected
25.description: A request or submission was rejected. For example, when a form was improperly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 2 'Blocked'.

26.caption: Unauthorized
26.description: An attempt to access a resource was denied due to an authorization check that failed. This is a more specific disposition than 2 'Blocked' and can be complemented with the authorizations attribute for more detail.

27.caption: Error
27.description: An error occurred during the processing of the activity or request. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The disposition is not mapped. See the disposition attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

firewall_rule.caption: Firewall Rule
firewall_rule.description: The firewall rule that pertains to the control that triggered the event, if applicable.

is_alert.caption: Alert
is_alert.description: Indicates that the event is considered to be an alertable signal. Should be set to true if disposition_id = Alert among other dispositions, and/or risk_level_id or severity_id of the event is elevated. Not all control events will be alertable, for example if disposition_id = Exonerated or disposition_id = Allowed.

malware.caption: Malware
malware.description: A list of Malware objects, describing details about the identified malware.

policy.caption: Policy
policy.description: The policy that pertains to the control that triggered the event, if applicable. For example the name of an anti-malware policy or an access control policy.

risk_details.caption: Risk Details
risk_details.description: Describes the risk associated with the finding.

risk_level.caption: Risk Level
risk_level.description: The risk level, normalized to the caption of the risk_level_id value.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The risk level is not mapped. See the risk_level attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

risk_score.caption: Risk Score
risk_score.description: The risk score as reported by the event source.

end_time_dt.caption: End Time
end_time_dt.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

start_time_dt.caption: Start Time
start_time_dt.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

time_dt.caption: Event Time
time_dt.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

authentication.description: Authentication events report authentication session activities such as user attempts a logon or logoff, successfully or otherwise.

entity_management.caption: Entity Management
entity_management.name: entity_management

access_list.caption: Access List
access_list.description: The list of requested access rights.

access_mask.caption: Access Mask
access_mask.description: The access mask in a platform-native format.

activity_id.caption: Activity ID
activity_id.description: The normalized identifier of the activity that triggered the event.

1.caption: Create
1.description: Create a new managed entity.

2.caption: Read
2.description: Read an existing managed entity.

3.caption: Update
3.description: Update an existing managed entity.

4.caption: Delete
4.description: Delete a managed entity.

5.caption: Move
5.description: Move or rename an existing managed entity.

6.caption: Enroll
6.description: Enroll an existing managed entity.

7.caption: Unenroll
7.description: Unenroll an existing managed entity.

8.caption: Enable
8.description: Enable an existing managed entity. Note: This is typically regarded as a semi-permanent, editor visible, syncable change.

9.caption: Disable
9.description: Disable an existing managed entity. Note: This is typically regarded as a semi-permanent, editor visible, syncable change.

10.caption: Activate
10.description: Activate an existing managed entity. Note: This is a typically regarded as a transient change, a change of state of the engine.

11.caption: Deactivate
11.description: Deactivate an existing managed entity. Note: This is a typically regarded as a transient change, a change of state of the engine.

12.caption: Suspend
12.description: Suspend an existing managed entity.

13.caption: Resume
13.description: Resume (unsuspend) an existing managed entity.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event activity is not mapped. See the activity_name attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

comment.caption: Comment
comment.description: The user provided comment about why the entity was changed.

entity.caption: Entity
entity.description: The managed entity that is being acted upon.

actor.caption: Actor
actor.description: The actor object describes details about the user/role/process that was the source of the activity. Note that this is not the threat actor of a campaign but may be part of a campaign.

http_request.caption: HTTP Request
http_request.description: Details about the underlying HTTP request.

http_response.caption: HTTP Response
http_response.description: Details about the underlying HTTP response.

src_endpoint.caption: Source Endpoint
src_endpoint.description: Details about the source of the IAM activity.

activity_name.caption: Activity
activity_name.description: The event activity name, as defined by the activity_id.

category_name.caption: Category
category_name.description: The event category name, as defined by category_uid value: Identity & Access Management.

category_uid.caption: Category ID
category_uid.description: The category unique identifier of the event.

3.caption: Identity & Access Management

class_name.caption: Class
class_name.description: The event class name, as defined by class_uid value: Entity Management.

class_uid.caption: Class ID
class_uid.description: The unique identifier of a class. A class describes the attributes available in an event.

3004.caption: Entity Management
3004.description: Entity Management events report activity by a managed client, a micro service, or a user at a management console. The activity can be a create, read, update, and delete operation on a managed entity.

duration.caption: Duration Milliseconds

end_time.caption: End Time

severity_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the event/finding severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

6.caption: Fatal

status.caption: Status
status.description: The event status, normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.
