credential_uid.caption: User Credential ID
credential_uid.description: The unique identifier of the user's credential. For example, AWS Access Key ID.

expiration_reason.caption: Expiration Reason
expiration_reason.description: The reason which triggered the session expiration.

is_mfa.caption: Multi Factor Authentication
is_mfa.description: Indicates whether Multi Factor Authentication was used during authentication.

is_remote.caption: Remote
is_remote.description: The indication of whether the session is remote.

is_vpn.caption: VPN Session
is_vpn.description: The indication of whether the session is a VPN session.

issuer.caption: Issuer Details
issuer.description: The identifier of the session issuer.

terminal.caption: Terminal
terminal.description: The Pseudo Terminal associated with the session. Ex: the tty or pts value.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the session.

uid_alt.caption: Alternate ID
uid_alt.description: The alternate unique identifier of the session. e.g. AWS ARN - arn:aws:sts::123344444444:assumed-role/Admin/example-session.

uuid.caption: UUID
uuid.description: The universally unique identifier of the session.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the session was created.

assessment.caption: Assessment
assessment.name: assessment
assessment.description: The Assessment object describes a point-in-time assessment, check, or evaluation of a specific configuration or signal against an asset, entity, person, or otherwise. For example, this can encapsulate os_signals from CrowdStrike Falcon Zero Trust Assessments, or account for Datastore configurations from Cyera, or capture details of Microsoft Intune configuration policies.

category.caption: Category
category.description: The category that the assessment is part of. For example: Prevention or Windows 10.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the assessment criteria, or a description of the specific configuration or signal the assessment is targeting.

meets_criteria.caption: Meets Criteria
meets_criteria.description: Determines whether the assessment against the specific configuration or signal meets the assessments criteria. For example, if the assessment checks if a Datastore is encrypted or not, having encryption would be evaluated as true.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the configuration or signal being assessed. For example: Kernel Mode Code Integrity (KMCI) or publicAccessibilityState.

policy.caption: Assessment Policy
policy.description: The details of any policy associated with an assessment.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the configuration or signal being assessed. For example: the signal_id.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

script.caption: Script
script.name: script
script.description: The Script object describes a script or command that can be executed by a shell, script engine, or interpreter. Examples include Bash, JavsScript, PowerShell, Python, VBScript, etc. Note that the term script here denotes not only a script contained within a file but also a script or command typed interactively by a user, supplied on the command line, or provided by some other file-less mechanism.

file.caption: File
file.description: Present if this script is associated with a file. Not present in the case of a file-less script.

hashes.caption: Hashes
hashes.description: An array of the script's cryptographic hashes. Note that these hashes are calculated on the script in its original encoding, and not on the normalized UTF-8 encoding found in the script_content attribute.

name.caption: Name
name.description: Unique identifier for the script or macro, independent of the containing file, used for tracking, auditing, and security analysis.

parent_uid.caption: Parent Unique ID
parent_uid.description: This attribute relates a sub-script to a parent script having the matching uid attribute. In the case of PowerShell, sub-script execution can be identified by matching the activity correlation ID of the raw ETW events provided by the OS.

script_content.caption: Script Content
script_content.description: The script content, normalized to UTF-8 encoding irrespective of its original encoding. When emitting this attribute, it may be appropriate to truncate large scripts. When consuming this attribute, large scripts should be anticipated.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The script type, normalized to the caption of the type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The script type is not mapped. See the type attribute which contains an event source specific value.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: Some script engines assign a unique ID to each individual execution of a given script. This attribute captures that unique ID. In the case of PowerShell, the unique ID corresponds to the ScriptBlockId in the raw ETW events provided by the OS.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

api.caption: API
api.name: api
api.description: The API, or Application Programming Interface, object represents  information pertaining to an API request and response.

group.caption: Group
group.description: The information pertaining to the API group.

request.caption: API Request Details
request.description: Details pertaining to the API request.

response.caption: API Response Details
response.description: Details pertaining to the API response.

service.caption: Service
service.description: The information pertaining to the API service.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the API service.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

ja4_fingerprint.caption: JA4+ Fingerprint
ja4_fingerprint.name: ja4_fingerprint
ja4_fingerprint.description: The JA4+ fingerprint object provides detailed fingerprint information about various aspects of network traffic which is both machine and human readable.

section_a.caption: JA4 Section A
section_a.description: The 'a' section of the JA4 fingerprint.

section_b.caption: JA4 Section B
section_b.description: The 'b' section of the JA4 fingerprint.

section_c.caption: JA4 Section C
section_c.description: The 'c' section of the JA4 fingerprint.

section_d.caption: JA4 Section D
section_d.description: The 'd' section of the JA4 fingerprint.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The JA4+ fingerprint type as defined by FoxIO, normalized to the caption of 'type_id'. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The identifier of the JA4+ fingerprint type.

1.caption: JA4
1.description: TLS Client Fingerprint.

2.caption: JA4Server
2.description: TLS Server Response/Session Fingerprint.

3.caption: JA4HTTP
3.description: HTTP Client Fingerprint.

4.caption: JA4Latency
4.description: Latency Measurement/Light Distance Fingerprint.

5.caption: JA4X509
5.description: X509 TLS Certificate Fingerprint.

6.caption: JA4SSH
6.description: SSH Traffic Fingerprint.

7.caption: JA4TCP
7.description: Passive TCP Client Fingerprint.

8.caption: JA4TCPServer
8.description: Passive TCP Server Fingerprint.

9.caption: JA4TCPScan
9.description: Active TCP Server Fingerprint.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

cve.caption: CVE
cve.name: cve
cve.description: The Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) object represents publicly disclosed cybersecurity vulnerabilities defined in CVE Program catalog (CVE). There is one CVE Record for each vulnerability in the catalog.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The Record Creation Date identifies when the CVE ID was issued to a CVE Numbering Authority (CNA) or the CVE Record was published on the CVE List. Note that the Record Creation Date does not necessarily indicate when this vulnerability was discovered, shared with the affected vendor, publicly disclosed, or updated in CVE.

cvss.caption: CVSS Score
cvss.description: The CVSS object details Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) scores from the advisory that are related to the vulnerability.

cwe.caption: CWE
cwe.description: The CWE object represents a weakness in a software system that can be exploited by a threat actor to perform an attack. The CWE object is based on the Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) catalog.

cwe_uid.caption: CWE UID
cwe_uid.description: The Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) unique identifier. For example: CWE-787.

cwe_url.caption: CWE URL
cwe_url.description: Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) definition URL. For example: https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/787.html.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: A brief description of the CVE Record.

epss.caption: EPSS
epss.description: The Exploit Prediction Scoring System (EPSS) object describes the estimated probability a vulnerability will be exploited. EPSS is a community-driven effort to combine descriptive information about vulnerabilities (CVEs) with evidence of actual exploitation in-the-wild. (EPSS).

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The Record Modified Date identifies when the CVE record was last updated.

product.caption: Product
product.description: The product where the vulnerability was discovered.

references.caption: References
references.description: A list of reference URLs with additional information about the CVE Record.

related_cwes.caption: Related CWEs
related_cwes.description: Describes the Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) details related to the CVE Record.

title.caption: Title
title.description: A title or a brief phrase summarizing the CVE record.

type.caption: Vulnerability Type
type.description:
The vulnerability type as selected from a large dropdown menu during CVE refinement.

Most frequently used vulnerability types are: DoS, Code Execution, Overflow, Memory Corruption, Sql Injection, XSS, Directory Traversal, Http Response Splitting, Bypass something, Gain Information, Gain Privileges, CSRF, File Inclusion. For more information see Vulnerabilities By Type distributions.

uid.caption: CVE ID
uid.description: The Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures unique number assigned to a specific computer vulnerability. A CVE Identifier begins with 4 digits representing the year followed by a sequence of digits that acts as a unique identifier. For example: CVE-2021-12345.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The Record Creation Date identifies when the CVE ID was issued to a CVE Numbering Authority (CNA) or the CVE Record was published on the CVE List. Note that the Record Creation Date does not necessarily indicate when this vulnerability was discovered, shared with the affected vendor, publicly disclosed, or updated in CVE.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The Record Modified Date identifies when the CVE record was last updated.

network_interface.caption: Network Interface
network_interface.name: network_interface
network_interface.description: The Network Interface object describes the type and associated attributes of a network interface.

hostname.caption: Hostname
hostname.description: The hostname associated with the network interface.

ip.caption: IP Address
ip.description: The IP address associated with the network interface.

mac.caption: MAC Address
mac.description: The MAC address of the network interface.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the network interface.

namespace.caption: Namespace
namespace.description: The namespace is useful in merger or acquisition situations. For example, when similar entities exist that you need to keep separate.

subnet_prefix.caption: Subnet Prefix Length
subnet_prefix.description: The subnet prefix length determines the number of bits used to represent the network part of the IP address. The remaining bits are reserved for identifying individual hosts within that subnet.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of network interface.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier for the network interface.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

vulnerability.caption: Vulnerability Details
vulnerability.name: vulnerability
vulnerability.description: The vulnerability is an unintended characteristic of a computing component or system configuration that multiplies the risk of an adverse event or a loss occurring either due to accidental exposure, deliberate attack, or conflict with new system components.

advisory.caption: Security Advisory
advisory.description: Detail about the security advisory, that is used to publicly disclose cybersecurity vulnerabilities by a vendor.

affected_code.caption: Affected Code
affected_code.description: List of Affected Code objects that describe details about code blocks identified as vulnerable.

affected_packages.caption: Affected Software Packages
affected_packages.description: List of software packages identified as affected by a vulnerability/vulnerabilities.

cve.caption: CVE
cve.description: Describes the Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) details related to the vulnerability.

cwe.caption: CWE
cwe.description: Describes the Common Weakness Enumeration (CWE) details related to the vulnerability.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the vulnerability.

exploit_last_seen_time.caption: Exploit Last Seen Time
exploit_last_seen_time.description: The time when the exploit was most recently observed.

first_seen_time.caption: First Seen
first_seen_time.description: The time when the vulnerability was first observed.

fix_available.caption: Fix Availability
fix_available.description: Indicates if a fix is available for the reported vulnerability.

is_exploit_available.caption: Exploit Availability
is_exploit_available.description: Indicates if an exploit or a PoC (proof-of-concept) is available for the reported vulnerability.

is_fix_available.caption: Fix Availability
is_fix_available.description: Indicates if a fix is available for the reported vulnerability.

kb_article_list.caption: Knowledgebase Articles
kb_article_list.description: A list of KB articles or patches related to an endpoint. A KB Article contains metadata that describes the patch or an update.

kb_articles.caption: Knowledgebase Articles
kb_articles.description: The KB article/s related to the entity. A KB Article contains metadata that describes the patch or an update.

last_seen_time.caption: Last Seen
last_seen_time.description: The time when the vulnerability was most recently observed.

packages.caption: Software Packages
packages.description: List of vulnerable packages as identified by the security product

references.caption: References
references.description: A list of reference URLs with additional information about the vulnerability.

related_vulnerabilities.caption: Related Vulnerability IDs
related_vulnerabilities.description: List of vulnerability IDs (e.g. CVE ID) that are related to this vulnerability.

remediation.caption: Remediation Guidance
remediation.description: The remediation recommendations on how to mitigate the identified vulnerability.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The vendor assigned severity of the vulnerability.

title.caption: Title
title.description: A title or a brief phrase summarizing the discovered vulnerability.

vendor_name.caption: Vendor Name
vendor_name.description: The name of the vendor that identified the vulnerability.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

exploit_last_seen_time_dt.caption: Exploit Last Seen Time
exploit_last_seen_time_dt.description: The time when the exploit was most recently observed.

first_seen_time_dt.caption: First Seen
first_seen_time_dt.description: The time when the vulnerability was first observed.

last_seen_time_dt.caption: Last Seen
last_seen_time_dt.description: The time when the vulnerability was most recently observed.

os.caption: Operating System (OS)
os.name: os
os.description: The Operating System (OS) object describes characteristics of an OS, such as Linux or Windows.

country.caption: Country
country.description:
The operating system country code, as defined by the ISO 3166-1 standard (Alpha-2 code).

Note: The two letter country code should be capitalized. For example: US or CA.

cpe_name.caption: The product CPE identifier
cpe_name.description: The Common Platform Enumeration (CPE) name as described by (NIST) For example: cpe:/a:apple:safari:16.2.

cpu_bits.caption: CPU Bits
cpu_bits.description: The cpu architecture, the number of bits used for addressing in memory. For example: 32 or 64.

edition.caption: OS Edition
edition.description: The operating system edition. For example: Professional.

kernel_release.caption: Kernel Release
kernel_release.description: The kernel release of the operating system. On Unix-based systems, this is determined from the uname -r command output, for example "5.15.0-122-generic".

lang.caption: Language
lang.description: The two letter lower case language codes, as defined by ISO 639-1. For example: en (English), de (German), or fr (French).

name.caption: Name
name.description: The operating system name.

sp_name.caption: OS Service Pack
sp_name.description: The name of the latest Service Pack.

sp_ver.caption: OS Service Pack Version
sp_ver.description: The version number of the latest Service Pack.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of the operating system.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The type identifier of the operating system.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the OS running on the device that originated the event. For example: "Windows 10", "OS X 10.7", or "iOS 9".

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

databucket.caption: Databucket
databucket.name: databucket
databucket.description: The databucket object is a basic container that holds data, typically organized through the use of data partitions.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the databucket was known to have been created.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the databucket.

encryption_details.caption: Encryption Details
encryption_details.description: The encryption details of the databucket. Should be populated if the databucket is encrypted.

file.caption: File
file.description: Details about the file/object within a databucket.

groups.caption: Groups
groups.description: The group names to which the databucket belongs.

is_encrypted.caption: Encrypted
is_encrypted.description: Indicates if the databucket is encrypted.

is_public.caption: Public
is_public.description: Indicates if the databucket is publicly accessible.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The most recent time when any changes, updates, or modifications were made within the databucket.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The databucket name.

size.caption: Size
size.description: The size of the databucket in bytes.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The databucket type.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The normalized identifier of the databucket type.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the databucket.

data_classification.caption: Data Classification
data_classification.description: The Data Classification object includes information about data classification levels and data category types.

data_classifications.caption: Data Classification
data_classifications.description: A list of Data Classification objects, that include information about data classification levels and data category types, indentified by a classifier.

agent_list.caption: Agent List
agent_list.description: A list of agent objects associated with a device, endpoint, or resource.

cloud_partition.caption: Cloud Partition
cloud_partition.description: The canonical cloud partition name to which the region is assigned (e.g. AWS Partitions: aws, aws-cn, aws-us-gov).

criticality.caption: Criticality
criticality.description: The criticality of the resource as defined by the event source.

group.caption: Group
group.description: The name of the related resource group.

hostname.caption: Hostname
hostname.description: The fully qualified name of the resource.

ip.caption: IP Address
ip.description: The IP address of the resource, in either IPv4 or IPv6 format.

is_backed_up.caption: Back Ups Configured
is_backed_up.description: Indicates whether the device or resource has a backup enabled, such as an automated snapshot or a cloud backup. For example, this is indicated by the cloudBackupEnabled value within JAMF Pro mobile devices or the registration of an AWS ARN with the AWS Backup service.

namespace.caption: Namespace
namespace.description: The namespace is useful when similar entities exist that you need to keep separate.

owner.caption: Owner
owner.description: The identity of the service or user account that owns the resource.

region.caption: Region
region.description: The cloud region of the resource.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the resource. For example 1.2.3.

labels.caption: Labels
labels.description: The list of labels associated to the resource.

tags.caption: Tags
tags.description: The list of tags; {key:value} pairs associated to the resource.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the databucket was known to have been created.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The most recent time when any changes, updates, or modifications were made within the databucket.

http_header.caption: HTTP Header
http_header.name: http_header
http_header.description: The HTTP Header object represents the headers sent in an HTTP request or response. HTTP headers are key-value pairs that convey additional information about the HTTP message, including details about the content, caching, authentication, encoding, and other aspects of the communication.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the HTTP header.

value.caption: Value
value.description: The value of the HTTP header.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

query_info.caption: Query Information
query_info.name: query_info
query_info.description: The query info object holds information related to data access within a datastore. To access, manipulate, delete, or retrieve data from a datastore, a query must be written using a specific syntax.

bytes.caption: Total Bytes
bytes.description: The size of the data returned from the query.

data.caption: Data
data.description: The data returned from the query execution.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The query name for a saved or scheduled query.

query_string.caption: Query String
query_string.description: A string representing the query code being run. For example: SELECT * FROM my_table

query_time.caption: Query Time
query_time.description: The time when the query was run.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the query.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

query_time_dt.caption: Query Time
query_time_dt.description: The time when the query was run.

managed_entity.caption: Managed Entity
managed_entity.name: managed_entity
managed_entity.description: The Managed Entity object describes the type and version of an entity, such as a user, device, or policy. For types in the type_id enum list, an associated attribute should be populated. If the type of entity is not in the type_id list, information can be put into the data attribute and the type attribute should identify the entity.

data.caption: Data
data.description: The managed entity content as a JSON object.

device.caption: Device
device.description: An addressable device, computer system or host.

group.caption: Group
group.description: The group object associated with an entity such as user, policy, or rule.

location.caption: Geo Location
location.description: The detailed geographical location usually associated with an IP address.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the managed entity.

org.caption: Organization
org.description: Organization and org unit relevant to the event or object.

policy.caption: Policy
policy.description: Describes details of a managed policy.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The managed entity type. For example: policy, user, organizational unit, device.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The type of the Managed Entity. It is recommended to also populate the type attribute with the associated label, or the source specific name if Other.

1.caption: Device
1.description: A managed Device entity. This item corresponds to population of the device attribute.

2.caption: User
2.description: A managed User entity. This item corresponds to population of the user attribute.

3.caption: Group
3.description: A managed Group entity. This item corresponds to population of the group attribute.

4.caption: Organization
4.description: A managed Organization entity. This item corresponds to population of the org attribute.

5.caption: Policy
5.description: A managed Policy entity. This item corresponds to population of the policy attribute.

6.caption: Email
6.description: A managed Email entity. This item corresponds to population of the email attribute.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The identifier of the managed entity.

user.caption: User
user.description: The user that pertains to the event or object.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the managed entity. For example: 1.2.3.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

d3f_technique.caption: MITRE DEFEND™ Technique
d3f_technique.name: d3f_technique
d3f_technique.description: The MITRE D3FEND™ Technique object describes the leaf defensive technique ID and/or name associated to a countermeasure.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the defensive technique. For example: IO Port Restriction.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The versioned permalink of the defensive technique. For example: https://d3fend.mitre.org/technique/d3f:IOPortRestriction/.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the defensive technique. For example: D3-IOPR.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

location.caption: Geo Location
location.name: location
location.description: The Geo Location object describes a geographical location, usually associated with an IP address.

aerial_height.caption: Aerial Height
aerial_height.description: Expressed as either height above takeoff location or height above ground level (AGL) for a UAS current location. This value is provided in meters and must have a minimum resolution of 1 m. Special Values: Invalid, No Value, or Unknown: -1000 m.

coordinates.caption: Coordinates
coordinates.description: A two-element array, containing a longitude/latitude pair. The format conforms with GeoJSON. For example: [-73.983, 40.719].

country.caption: Country
country.description:
The ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 country code.

Note: The two letter country code should be capitalized. For example: US or CA.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the geographical location.

geodetic_altitude.caption: Geodetic Altitude
geodetic_altitude.description: The aircraft distance above or below the ellipsoid as measured along a line that passes through the aircraft and is normal to the surface of the WGS-84 ellipsoid. This value is provided in meters and must have a minimum resolution of 1 m. Special Values: Invalid, No Value, or Unknown: -1000 m.

geodetic_vertical_accuracy.caption: Geodetic Vertical Accuracy
geodetic_vertical_accuracy.description: Provides quality/containment on geodetic altitude. This is based on ADS-B Geodetic Vertical Accuracy (GVA). Measured in meters.

geohash.caption: Geohash
geohash.description:
Geohash of the geo-coordinates (latitude and longitude).

Geohashing is a geocoding system used to encode geographic coordinates in decimal degrees, to a single string.

horizontal_accuracy.caption: Horizontal Accuracy
horizontal_accuracy.description: Provides quality/containment on horizontal position. This is based on ADS-B NACp. Measured in meters.

is_on_premises.caption: On Premises
is_on_premises.description: The indication of whether the location is on premises.

isp.caption: ISP
isp.description: The name of the Internet Service Provider (ISP).

lat.caption: Latitude
lat.description: The geographical Latitude coordinate represented in Decimal Degrees (DD). For example: 42.361145.

long.caption: Longitude
long.description: The geographical Longitude coordinate represented in Decimal Degrees (DD). For example: -71.057083.

postal_code.caption: Postal Code
postal_code.description: The postal code of the location.

pressure_altitude.caption: Pressure Altitude
pressure_altitude.description: The uncorrected barometric pressure altitude (based on reference standard 29.92 inHg, 1013.25 mb) provides a reference for algorithms that utilize 'altitude deltas' between aircraft. This value is provided in meters and must have a minimum resolution of 1 m.. Special Values: Invalid, No Value, or Unknown: -1000 m.

provider.caption: Provider
provider.description: The provider of the geographical location data.

region.caption: Region
region.description: The alphanumeric code that identifies the principal subdivision (e.g. province or state) of the country. For example, 'CH-VD' for the Canton of Vaud, Switzerland

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

resource_details.caption: Resource Details
resource_details.name: resource_details
resource_details.description: The Resource Details object describes details about resources that were affected by the activity/event.

agent_list.caption: Agent List
agent_list.description: A list of agent objects associated with a device, endpoint, or resource.

cloud_partition.caption: Cloud Partition
cloud_partition.description: The canonical cloud partition name to which the region is assigned (e.g. AWS Partitions: aws, aws-cn, aws-us-gov).

criticality.caption: Criticality
criticality.description: The criticality of the resource as defined by the event source.

group.caption: Group
group.description: The name of the related resource group.

hostname.caption: Hostname
hostname.description: The fully qualified name of the resource.

ip.caption: IP Address
ip.description: The IP address of the resource, in either IPv4 or IPv6 format.

is_backed_up.caption: Back Ups Configured
is_backed_up.description: Indicates whether the device or resource has a backup enabled, such as an automated snapshot or a cloud backup. For example, this is indicated by the cloudBackupEnabled value within JAMF Pro mobile devices or the registration of an AWS ARN with the AWS Backup service.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the resource.

namespace.caption: Namespace
namespace.description: The namespace is useful when similar entities exist that you need to keep separate.

owner.caption: Owner
owner.description: The identity of the service or user account that owns the resource.

region.caption: Region
region.description: The cloud region of the resource.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the resource. For example 1.2.3.

labels.caption: Labels
labels.description: The list of labels associated to the resource.

tags.caption: Tags
tags.description: The list of tags; {key:value} pairs associated to the resource.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The resource type as defined by the event source.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the resource.

data_classification.caption: Data Classification
data_classification.description: The Data Classification object includes information about data classification levels and data category types.

data_classifications.caption: Data Classification
data_classifications.description: A list of Data Classification objects, that include information about data classification levels and data category types, indentified by a classifier.

raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

ticket.caption: Ticket
ticket.name: ticket
ticket.description: The Ticket object represents ticket in the customer's systems like Salesforce, jira etc.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The url of a ticket in the ticket system.

type.caption: Ticket Type
type.description: The linked ticket type determines whether the ticket is internal or in an external ticketing system.

type_id.caption: Ticket Type ID
type_id.description: The normalized identifier for the ticket type.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: Unique ticket identifier like ticket id.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

malware.caption: Malware
malware.name: malware
malware.description: The Malware object describes the classification of known malicious software, which is intentionally designed to cause damage to a computer, server, client, or computer network.

classification_ids.caption: Classification IDs
classification_ids.description: The list of normalized identifiers of the malware classifications. Reference: STIX Malware Types

99.caption: Other
99.description: The classification is not mapped. See the classifications attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

classifications.caption: Classifications
classifications.description: The list of malware classifications, normalized to the captions of the classification_ids values. In the case of 'Other', they are defined by the event source.

cves.caption: CVE List
cves.description: List of Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE).

name.caption: Name
name.description: The malware name, as reported by the detection engine.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The filesystem path of the malware that was observed.

provider.caption: Provider
provider.description: The provider of the malware information.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The malware unique identifier, as reported by the detection engine. For example a virus id or an IPS signature id.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

occurrence_details.caption: Occurrence Details
occurrence_details.name: occurrence_details
occurrence_details.description: Details about where in the target entity, specified information was discovered. Only the attributes, relevant to the target entity type should be populuated.

cell_name.caption: Cell Name
cell_name.description: The cell name/reference in a spreadsheet. e.g A2

column_name.caption: Column Name
column_name.description: The column name in a spreadsheet, where the information was discovered.

column_number.caption: Column Number
column_number.description: The column number in a spreadsheet or a plain text document, where the information was discovered.

end_line.caption: End Line
end_line.description: The line number of the last line of the file, where the information was discovered.

json_path.caption: JSON Path
json_path.description: The JSON path of the attribute in a json record, where the information was discovered

page_number.caption: Page Number
page_number.description: The page number in a document, where the information was discovered.

record_index_in_array.caption: Record Index in Array
record_index_in_array.description: The index of the record in the array of records, where the information was discovered. e.g. the index of a record in an array of JSON records in a file.

row_number.caption: Row Number
row_number.description: The row number in a spreadsheet, where the information was discovered.

start_line.caption: Start Line
start_line.description: The line number of the first line of the file, where the information was discovered.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

kernel.caption: Kernel Resource
kernel.name: kernel
kernel.description: The Kernel Resource object provides information about a specific kernel resource, including its name and type. It describes essential attributes associated with a resource managed by the kernel of an operating system.

is_system.caption: System
is_system.description: The indication of whether the object is part of the operating system.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the kernel resource.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The full path of the kernel resource.

system_call.caption: System Call
system_call.description: The system call that was invoked.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of the kernel resource.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The type of the kernel resource.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

http_response.caption: HTTP Response
http_response.name: http_response
http_response.description: The HTTP Response object contains detailed information about the response sent from a web server to the requester. It encompasses attributes and metadata that describe the response status, headers, body content, and other relevant information.

body_length.caption: Response Body Length
body_length.description: The actual length of the HTTP response body, in number of bytes, independent of a potentially existing Content-Length header.

code.caption: Response Code
code.description: The Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) status code returned from the web server to the client. For example, 200.

content_type.caption: HTTP Content Type
content_type.description: The request header that identifies the original media type of the resource (prior to any content encoding applied for sending).

http_headers.caption: HTTP Headers
http_headers.description: Additional HTTP headers of an HTTP request or response.

latency.caption: Latency
latency.description: The HTTP response latency measured in milliseconds.

length.caption: Response Length
length.description: The length of the entire HTTP response, in number of bytes.

message.caption: Message
message.description: The description of the event/finding, as defined by the source.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The response status. For example: A successful HTTP status of 'OK' which corresponds to a code of 200.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

device.caption: Device
device.name: device
device.description: The Device object represents an addressable computer system or host, which is typically connected to a computer network and participates in the transmission or processing of data within the computer network.

autoscale_uid.caption: Autoscale UID
autoscale_uid.description: The unique identifier of the cloud autoscale configuration.

boot_time.caption: Boot Time
boot_time.description: The time the system was booted.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the device was known to have been created.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the device, ordinarily as reported by the operating system.

domain.caption: Domain
domain.description: The network domain where the device resides. For example: work.example.com.

eid.caption: EID
eid.description: An Embedded Identity Document, is a unique serial number that identifies an eSIM-enabled device.

first_seen_time.caption: First Seen
first_seen_time.description: The initial discovery time of the device.

groups.caption: Groups
groups.description: The group names to which the device belongs. For example: ["Windows Laptops", "Engineering"].

hypervisor.caption: Hypervisor
hypervisor.description: The name of the hypervisor running on the device. For example, Xen, VMware, Hyper-V, VirtualBox, etc.

image.caption: Image
image.description: The image used as a template to run the virtual machine.

iccid.caption: ICCID
iccid.description: The Integrated Circuit Card Identification of a mobile device. Typically it is a unique 18 to 22 digit number that identifies a SIM card.

imei.caption: IMEI
imei.description: The International Mobile Equipment Identity that is associated with the device.

imei_list.caption: IMEI List
imei_list.description: The International Mobile Equipment Identity values that are associated with the device.

ip.caption: IP Address
ip.description: The device IP address, in either IPv4 or IPv6 format.

is_backed_up.caption: Back Ups Configured
is_backed_up.description: Indicates whether the device or resource has a backup enabled, such as an automated snapshot or a cloud backup. For example, this is indicated by the cloudBackupEnabled value within JAMF Pro mobile devices or the registration of an AWS ARN with the AWS Backup service.

is_compliant.caption: Compliant Device
is_compliant.description: The event occurred on a compliant device.

is_managed.caption: Managed Device
is_managed.description: The event occurred on a managed device.

is_mobile_account_active.caption: Mobile Account Active
is_mobile_account_active.description: Indicates whether the device has an active mobile account. For example, this is indicated by the itunesStoreAccountActive value within JAMF Pro mobile devices.

is_personal.caption: Personal Device
is_personal.description: The event occurred on a personal device.

is_shared.caption: Shared Device
is_shared.description: The event occurred on a shared device.

is_supervised.caption: Supervised Device
is_supervised.description: The event occurred on a supervised device. Devices that are supervised are typically mobile devices managed by a Mobile Device Management solution and are restricted from specific behaviors such as Apple AirDrop.

is_trusted.caption: Trusted Device
is_trusted.description: The event occurred on a trusted device.

last_seen_time.caption: Last Seen
last_seen_time.description: The most recent discovery time of the device.

location.caption: Geo Location
location.description: The geographical location of the device.

meid.caption: MEID
meid.description: The Mobile Equipment Identifier. It's a unique number that identifies a Code Division Multiple Access (CDMA) mobile device.

model.caption: Model
model.description: The model of the device. For example ThinkPad X1 Carbon.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The time when the device was last known to have been modified.

name.caption: Name
name.description:
The alternate device name, ordinarily as assigned by an administrator.

Note: The Name could be any other string that helps to identify the device, such as a phone number; for example 310-555-1234.

network_interfaces.caption: Network Interfaces
network_interfaces.description:
The network interfaces that are associated with the device, one for each unique MAC address/IP address/hostname/name combination.

Note: The first element of the array is the network information that pertains to the event.

org.caption: Organization
org.description: Organization and org unit related to the device.

os_machine_uuid.caption: OS Machine UUID
os_machine_uuid.description: The operating system assigned Machine ID. In Windows, this is the value stored at the registry path: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Cryptography\MachineGuid. In Linux, this is stored in the file: /etc/machine-id.

region.caption: Region
region.description: The region where the virtual machine is located. For example, an AWS Region.

risk_level.caption: Risk Level
risk_level.description: The risk level, normalized to the caption of the risk_level_id value.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The risk level is not mapped. See the risk_level attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

risk_score.caption: Risk Score
risk_score.description: The risk score as reported by the event source.

type.description: The device type. For example: unknown, server, desktop, laptop, tablet, mobile, virtual, browser, or other.

data_classification.caption: Data Classification
data_classification.name: data_classification
data_classification.description: The Data Classification object includes information about data classification levels and data category types.

category.caption: Category
category.description: The name of the data classification category that data matched into, e.g. Financial, Personal, Governmental, etc.

category_id.caption: Category ID
category_id.description: The normalized identifier of the data classification category.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The type is not mapped. See the data_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

1.caption: Personal
1.description: Any Personally Identifiable Information (PII), Electronic Personal Health Information (ePHI), or similarly personal information. E.g., full name, home address, date of birth, etc.

2.caption: Governmental
2.description: Any sensitive government identification number related to a person or other classified material. E.g., Passport numbers, driver license numbers, business identification, taxation identifiers, etc.

3.caption: Financial
3.description: Any financially-related sensitive information or Cardholder Data (CHD). E.g., banking account numbers, credit card numbers, International Banking Account Numbers (IBAN), SWIFT codes, etc.

4.caption: Business
4.description: Any business-specific sensitive data such as intellectual property, trademarks, copyrights, human resource data, Board of Directors meeting minutes, and similar.

5.caption: Military and Law Enforcement
5.description: Any mission-specific sensitive data for military, law enforcement, or other government agencies such as specifically classified data, weapon systems information, or other planning data.

6.caption: Security
6.description: Any sensitive security-related data such as passwords, passkeys, IP addresses, API keys, credentials and similar secrets. E.g., AWS Access Secret Key, SaaS API Keys, user passwords, database credentials, etc.

99.caption: Other
99.description: Any other type of data classification or a multi-variate classification made up of several other classification categories.

classifier_details.caption: Classifier Details
classifier_details.description: Describes details about the classifier used for data classification.

confidentiality.caption: Confidentiality
confidentiality.description: The file content confidentiality, normalized to the confidentiality_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

confidentiality_id.caption: Confidentiality ID
confidentiality_id.description: The normalized identifier of the file content confidentiality indicator.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The confidentiality is not mapped. See the confidentiality attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

discovery_details.caption: Discovery Details
discovery_details.description: Details about the data discovered by classification job.

policy.caption: Policy
policy.description: Details about the data policy that governs data handling and security measures related to classification.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The source URL pointing towards the full classifcation job details.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The resultant status of the classification job normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

status_details.caption: Status Details
status_details.description: The contextual description of the status, status_id value.

status_id.caption: Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized status identifier of the classification job.

1.caption: Complete
1.description: The classification job completed for the evaluated resource.

2.caption: Partial
2.description: The classification job partially completed for the evaluated resource.

3.caption: Fail
3.description: The classification job failed for the evaluated resource.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The classification job type id is not mapped.

total.caption: Total
total.description: The total count of discovered entities, by the classification job.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the classification job.

raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.
