http_request.caption: HTTP Request
http_request.name: http_request
http_request.description: The HTTP Request object represents the attributes of a request made to a web server. It encapsulates the details and metadata associated with an HTTP request, including the request method, headers, URL, query parameters, body content, and other relevant information.

args.caption: HTTP Arguments
args.description: The arguments sent along with the HTTP request.

body_length.caption: Request Body Length
body_length.description: The actual length of the HTTP request body, in number of bytes, independent of a potentially existing Content-Length header.

http_headers.caption: HTTP Headers
http_headers.description: Additional HTTP headers of an HTTP request or response.

http_method.caption: HTTP Method
http_method.description: The HTTP request method indicates the desired action to be performed for a given resource.

CONNECT.caption: Connect
CONNECT.description: The CONNECT method establishes a tunnel to the server identified by the target resource.

DELETE.caption: Delete
DELETE.description: The DELETE method deletes the specified resource.

GET.caption: Get
GET.description: The GET method requests a representation of the specified resource. Requests using GET should only retrieve data.

HEAD.caption: Head
HEAD.description: The HEAD method asks for a response identical to a GET request, but without the response body.

OPTIONS.caption: Options
OPTIONS.description: The OPTIONS method describes the communication options for the target resource.

POST.caption: Post
POST.description: The POST method submits an entity to the specified resource, often causing a change in state or side effects on the server.

PUT.caption: Put
PUT.description: The PUT method replaces all current representations of the target resource with the request payload.

TRACE.caption: Trace
TRACE.description: The TRACE method performs a message loop-back test along the path to the target resource.

length.caption: Request Length
length.description: The length of the entire HTTP request, in number of bytes.

referrer.caption: HTTP Referrer
referrer.description: The request header that identifies the address of the previous web page, which is linked to the current web page or resource being requested.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the http request.

url.caption: URL
url.description: The URL object that pertains to the request.

user_agent.caption: HTTP User-Agent
user_agent.description: The request header that identifies the operating system and web browser.

x_forwarded_for.caption: X-Forwarded-For
x_forwarded_for.description: The X-Forwarded-For header identifying the originating IP address(es) of a client connecting to a web server through an HTTP proxy or a load balancer.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

aircraft.caption: Aircraft
aircraft.name: aircraft
aircraft.description: The Aircraft object represents any aircraft or otherwise airborne asset such as an unmanned system, airplane, balloon, spacecraft, or otherwise. The Aircraft object is intended to normalized data captured or otherwise logged from active radar, passive radar, multi-spectral systems, or the Automatic Dependant Broadcast - Surveillance (ADS-B), and/or Mode S systems.

location.caption: Geo Location
location.description: The detailed geographical location usually associated with an IP address.

model.caption: Model
model.description: The model name of the aircraft or unmanned system.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the aircraft, such as the such as the flight name or callsign.

serial_number.caption: Serial Number
serial_number.description: The serial number of the aircraft.

speed.caption: Speed
speed.description: Ground speed of flight. This value is provided in meters per second with a minimum resolution of 0.25 m/s. Special Values: Invalid, No Value, or Unknown: 255 m/s.

speed_accuracy.caption: Speed Accuracy
speed_accuracy.description: Provides quality/containment on horizontal ground speed. Measured in meters/second.

track_direction.caption: Track Direction
track_direction.description: Direction of flight expressed as a “True North-based” ground track angle. This value is provided in clockwise degrees with a minimum resolution of 1 degree. If aircraft is not moving horizontally, use the “Unknown” value

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The primary identification identifier for an aircraft, such as the 24-bit International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) identifier of the aircraft, as 6 hex digits.

uid_alt.caption: Alternate ID
uid_alt.description: A secondary identification identifier for an aircraft, such as the 4-digit squawk (octal representation).

vertical_speed.caption: Vertical Speed
vertical_speed.description: Vertical speed upward relative to the WGS-84 datum, measured in meters per second. Special Values: Invalid, No Value, or Unknown: 63 m/s.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

unmanned_aerial_system.caption: Unmanned Aerial System
unmanned_aerial_system.name: unmanned_aerial_system
unmanned_aerial_system.description: The Unmanned Aerial System object describes the characteristics, Position Location Information (PLI), and other metadata of Unmanned Aerial Systems (UAS) and other unmanned and drone systems used in Remote ID. Remote ID is defined in the Standard Specification for Remote ID and Tracking (ASTM Designation: F3411-22a) ASTM F3411-22a.

location.caption: UAS Position Location Information
location.description: The detailed geographical location usually associated with an IP address.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the unmanned system as reported by tracking or sensing hardware.

serial_number.caption: Serial Number
serial_number.description: The serial number of the unmanned system. This is expressed in CTA-2063-A format.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of the UAS. For example, Helicopter, Gyroplane, Rocket, etc.

0.caption: Unknown/Undeclared
0.description: The UAS type is empty or not declared.

10.caption: Airship
10.description: E.g., a blimp.

11.caption: Free Fall/Parachute
11.description: Parachutes, or objects without any power or propulsion mechanism.

2.caption: Helicopter
2.description: Can also be a Multi-rotor Unmanned Aircraft (e.g., Quad-copter).

4.caption: Hybrid Lift
4.description: Fixed wing aircraft that can take off vertically.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

uid.caption: UAS ID
uid.description: The primary identification identifier for an unmanned system. This can be a Serial Number (in CTA-2063-A format, the Registration ID (provided by the CAA, a UTM, or a unique Session ID.

uid_alt.caption: UAS Alternate ID
uid_alt.description: A secondary identification identifier for an unmanned system. This can be a Serial Number (in CTA-2063-A format, the Registration ID (provided by the CAA, a UTM, or a unique Session ID.

uuid.caption: UTM UUID
uuid.description: The Unmanned Aircraft System Traffic Management (UTM) provided universal unique ID (UUID) traceable to a non-obfuscated ID where this UTM UUID acts as a 'session id' to protect exposure of operationally sensitive information.

model.caption: Model
model.description: The model name of the aircraft or unmanned system.

speed.caption: Speed
speed.description: Ground speed of flight. This value is provided in meters per second with a minimum resolution of 0.25 m/s. Special Values: Invalid, No Value, or Unknown: 255 m/s.

speed_accuracy.caption: Speed Accuracy
speed_accuracy.description: Provides quality/containment on horizontal ground speed. Measured in meters/second.

track_direction.caption: Track Direction
track_direction.description: Direction of flight expressed as a “True North-based” ground track angle. This value is provided in clockwise degrees with a minimum resolution of 1 degree. If aircraft is not moving horizontally, use the “Unknown” value

vertical_speed.caption: Vertical Speed
vertical_speed.description: Vertical speed upward relative to the WGS-84 datum, measured in meters per second. Special Values: Invalid, No Value, or Unknown: 63 m/s.

desc.caption: Description

groups.caption: Groups

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The most recent time when any changes, updates, or modifications were made within the database.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The database name, ordinarily as assigned by a database administrator.

size.caption: Size
size.description: The size of the database in bytes.

type_id.description: The normalized identifier of the database type.

data_classification.description: The Data Classification object includes information about data classification levels and data category types.

data_classifications.caption: Data Classification
data_classifications.description: A list of Data Classification objects, that include information about data classification levels and data category types, indentified by a classifier.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time

table.caption: Table
table.name: table
table.description: The table object represents a table within a structured relational database or datastore, which contains columns and rows of data that are able to be create, updated, deleted and queried.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the table was known to have been created.

desc.caption: Description

groups.caption: Groups

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The most recent time when any changes, updates, or modifications were made within the table.

name.description: The table name, ordinarily as assigned by a database administrator.

size.caption: Size
size.description: The size of the data table in bytes.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the table.

remediation.caption: Remediation
remediation.name: remediation
remediation.description: The Remediation object describes the recommended remediation steps to address identified issue(s).

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the remediation strategy.

kb_article_list.caption: Knowledgebase Articles
kb_article_list.description: A list of KB articles or patches related to an endpoint. A KB Article contains metadata that describes the patch or an update.

kb_articles.caption: Knowledgebase Articles
kb_articles.description: The KB article/s related to the entity. A KB Article contains metadata that describes the patch or an update.

references.caption: References
references.description: A list of supporting URL/s, references that help describe the remediation strategy.

security_state.caption: Security State
security_state.name: security_state
security_state.description: The Security State object describes the security related state of a managed entity.

state.caption: Security State
state.description: The security state, normalized to the caption of the state_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

state_id.caption: Security State ID
state_id.description: The security state of the managed entity.

1.caption: Missing or outdated content
1.description: The content is missing or outdated.

10.caption: Content is locked
10.description: The content is locked to a specific version.

11.caption: Not installed
11.description: The entity is not installed.

12.caption: Writable system partition
12.description: The system partition is writeable.

13.caption: SafetyNet failure
13.description: The device has failed the SafetyNet check.

14.caption: Failed boot verify
14.description: The device has failed the boot verification process.

15.caption: Modified execution environment
15.description: The execution environment has been modified.

16.caption: SELinux disabled
16.description: The SELinux security feature has been disabled.

17.caption: Elevated privilege shell
17.description: An elevated privilege shell has been detected.

18.caption: iOS file system altered
18.description: The file system has been altered on an iOS device.

19.caption: Open remote access
19.description: Remote access is enabled.

2.caption: Policy mismatch
2.description: Not in compliance with the expected security policy.

20.caption: OTA updates disabled
20.description: Mobile OTA (Over The Air) updates have been disabled.

21.caption: Rooted
21.description: The device has been modified to allow root access.

22.caption: Android partition modified
22.description: The Android partition has been modified.

23.caption: Compliance failure
23.description: The entity is not compliant with the associated security policy.

3.caption: In network quarantine
3.description: Isolated from the network.

4.caption: Protection off
4.description: Not protected by a security solution.

5.caption: Protection malfunction
5.description: The security solution is not functioning properly.

6.caption: Protection not licensed
6.description: The security solution does not have a valid license.

7.caption: Unremediated threat
7.description: A detected threat has not been remediated.

8.caption: Suspicious reputation
8.description: Reputation of the entity is suspicious.

9.caption: Reboot pending
9.description: A reboot is required for one or more pending actions.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The security state is not mapped. See the state attribute, which contains data source specific values.

vendor_attributes.caption: Vendor Attributes
vendor_attributes.name: vendor_attributes
vendor_attributes.description:
The Vendor Attributes object can be used to represent values of attributes populated by the Vendor/Finding Provider. It can help distinguish between the vendor-prodvided values and consumer-updated values, of key attributes like severity_id.
The original finding producer should not populate this object. It should be populated by consuming systems that support data mutability.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The finding severity, as reported by the Vendor (Finding Provider). The value should be normalized to the caption of the severity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

severity_id.caption: Severity ID
severity_id.description: The finding severity ID, as reported by the Vendor (Finding Provider).

1.caption: Informational
1.description: Informational message. No action required.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

4.caption: High
4.description: Action is required immediately.

5.caption: Critical
5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

6.caption: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event/finding severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

load_balancer.caption: Load Balancer
load_balancer.name: load_balancer
load_balancer.description: The load balancer object describes the load balancer entity and contains additional information regarding the distribution of traffic across a network.

classification.caption: Classification
classification.description: The request classification as defined by the load balancer.

code.caption: Response Code
code.description: The numeric response status code detailing the connection from the load balancer to the destination target.

dst_endpoint.caption: Destination Endpoint
dst_endpoint.description: The destination to which the load balancer is distributing traffic.

endpoint_connections.caption: Endpoint Connections
endpoint_connections.description: An object detailing the load balancer connection attempts and responses.

ip.caption: IP Address
ip.description: The IP address of the load balancer node that handled the client request. Note: the load balancer may have other IP addresses, and this is not an IP address of the target/distribution endpoint - see dst_endpoint.

message.caption: Message
message.description: The load balancer message.

metrics.caption: Metrics
metrics.description: General purpose metrics associated with the load balancer.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the load balancer.

status_detail.caption: Status Detail
status_detail.description: The status detail contains additional status information about the load balancer distribution event.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier for the load balancer.

discovery_details.name: discovery_details
discovery_details.description: The Discovery Details object describes results of a discovery task/job.

count.caption: Count
count.description: The number of discovered entities of the specified type.

occurrence_details.caption: Occurrence Details
occurrence_details.description: Details about where in the target entity, specified information was discovered. Only the attributes, relevant to the target entity type should be populuated.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The specific type of information that was discovered. e.g. name, phone_number, etc.

value.caption: Value
value.description: Optionally, the specific value of discovered information.

cvss.caption: CVSS Score
cvss.name: cvss
cvss.description: The Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) object provides a way to capture the principal characteristics of a vulnerability and produce a numerical score reflecting its severity.

base_score.caption: Base Score
base_score.description: The CVSS base score. For example: 9.1.

depth.caption: CVSS Depth
depth.description: The CVSS depth represents a depth of the equation used to calculate CVSS score.

metrics.caption: Metrics
metrics.description: The Common Vulnerability Scoring System metrics. This attribute contains information on the CVE's impact. If the CVE has been analyzed, this attribute will contain any CVSSv2 or CVSSv3 information associated with the vulnerability. For example: { {"Access Vector", "Network"}, {"Access Complexity", "Low"}, ...}.

overall_score.caption: Overall Score
overall_score.description: The CVSS overall score, impacted by base, temporal, and environmental metrics. For example: 9.1.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description:
The Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) Qualitative Severity Rating. A textual representation of the numeric score.

CVSS v2.0
  • Low (0.0 – 3.9)
  • Medium (4.0 – 6.9)
  • High (7.0 – 10.0)

CVSS v3.0
  • None (0.0)
  • Low (0.1 - 3.9)
  • Medium (4.0 - 6.9)
  • High (7.0 - 8.9)
  • Critical (9.0 - 10.0)

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The source URL for the CVSS score. For example: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-44228

vector_string.caption: Vector String
vector_string.description: The CVSS vector string is a text representation of a set of CVSS metrics. It is commonly used to record or transfer CVSS metric information in a concise form. For example: 3.1/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:H.

vendor_name.caption: Vendor Name
vendor_name.description: The vendor that provided the CVSS score. For example: NVD, REDHAT etc.

job.name: job
job.description: The Job object provides information about a scheduled job or task, including its name, command line, and state. It encompasses attributes that describe the properties and status of the scheduled job.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the job was created.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the job.

file.caption: File
file.description: The file that pertains to the job.

last_run_time.caption: Last Run
last_run_time.description: The time when the job was last run.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the job.

next_run_time.caption: Next Run
next_run_time.description: The time when the job will next be run.

run_state.caption: Run State
run_state.description: The run state of the job.

run_state_id.caption: Run State ID
run_state_id.description: The run state ID of the job.

user.caption: User
user.description: The user that created the job.

unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

analytic.caption: Analytic
analytic.name: analytic
analytic.description: The Analytic object contains details about the analytic technique used to analyze and derive insights from the data or information that led to the creation of a finding or conclusion.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the analytic that generated the finding.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the analytic that generated the finding.

related_analytics.caption: Related Analytics
related_analytics.description: Other analytics related to this analytic.

@deprecated.message: Related Analytics has been decoupled from this object, instead use finding_info.related_analytics.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The analytic type.

1.caption: Rule
1.description: A Rule in security analytics refers to predefined criteria or conditions set to monitor, alert, or enforce policies, playing a crucial role in access control, threat detection, and regulatory compliance across security systems.

10.caption: Partial Data Match
10.description: Partial Data Match involves identifying instances where segments of sensitive information or patterns match, facilitating nuanced DLP and threat detection without requiring complete data conformity.

11.caption: Indexed Data Match
11.description: Indexed Data Match refers to comparing content against a pre-compiled index of sensitive information to efficiently detect and prevent unauthorized access or breaches, streamlining DLP and compliance efforts.

2.caption: Behavioral
2.description: Behavioral analytics focus on monitoring and analyzing user or system actions to identify deviations from established patterns, aiding in the detection of insider threats, fraud, and advanced persistent threats (APTs).

3.caption: Statistical
3.description: Statistical analytics pertains to analyzing data patterns and anomalies using statistical models to predict, detect, and respond to potential threats, enhancing overall security posture through informed decision-making.

4.caption: Learning (ML/DL)
4.description: Learning (ML/DL) encompasses techniques that can "learn" from known data to create analytics that generalize to new data. There may be a statistical component to these techniques, but it is not a requirement.

5.caption: Fingerprinting
5.description: Fingerprinting is the technique of collecting detailed system data, including software versions and configurations, to enhance threat detection, data loss prevention (DLP), and endpoint detection and response (EDR) capabilities.

6.caption: Tagging
6.description: Tagging refers to the practice of assigning labels or identifiers to data, users, assets, or activities to monitor, control access, and facilitate incident response across various security domains such as DLP and EDR.

7.caption: Keyword Match
7.description: Keyword Match involves scanning content for specific terms to identify sensitive information, potential threats, or policy violations, aiding in DLP and compliance monitoring.

8.caption: Regular Expressions
8.description: Regular Expressions are used to define complex search patterns for identifying, validating, and extracting specific data sets or threats within digital content, enhancing DLP, EDR, and threat detection mechanisms.

9.caption: Exact Data Match
9.description: Exact Data Match is a precise comparison technique used to detect the unauthorized use or exposure of specific, sensitive information, crucial for enforcing DLP policies and protecting against data breaches.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the analytic that generated the finding.

raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

digital_signature.caption: Digital Signature
digital_signature.name: digital_signature
digital_signature.description: The Digital Signature object contains information about the cryptographic mechanism used to verify the authenticity, integrity, and origin of the file or application.

algorithm.caption: Algorithm
algorithm.description: The digital signature algorithm used to create the signature, normalized to the caption of 'algorithm_id'. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

algorithm_id.caption: Algorithm ID
algorithm_id.description: The identifier of the normalized digital signature algorithm.

1.caption: DSA
1.description: Digital Signature Algorithm (DSA).

2.caption: RSA
2.description: Rivest-Shamir-Adleman (RSA) Algorithm.

3.caption: ECDSA
3.description: Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm.

4.caption: Authenticode
4.description: Microsoft Authenticode Digital Signature Algorithm.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The algorithm is not mapped. See the algorithm attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

certificate.caption: Certificate
certificate.description: The certificate object containing information about the digital certificate.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the digital signature was created.

developer_uid.caption: Developer UID
developer_uid.description: The developer ID on the certificate that signed the file.

digest.caption: Message Digest
digest.description: The message digest attribute contains the fixed length message hash representation and the corresponding hashing algorithm information.

state.caption: State
state.description: The digital signature state defines the signature state, normalized to the caption of 'state_id'. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

state_id.caption: State ID
state_id.description: The normalized identifier of the signature state.

1.caption: Valid
1.description: The digital signature is valid.

2.caption: Expired
2.description: The digital signature is not valid due to expiration of certificate.

3.caption: Revoked
3.description: The digital signature is invalid due to certificate revocation.

4.caption: Suspended
4.description: The digital signature is invalid due to certificate suspension.

5.caption: Pending
5.description: The digital signature state is pending.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The state is not mapped. See the state attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

logger.caption: Logger
logger.name: logger
logger.description: The Logger object represents the device and product where events are stored with times for receipt and transmission.  This may be at the source device where the event occurred, a remote scanning device, intermediate hops, or the ultimate destination.

device.caption: Device
device.description: The device where the events are logged.

event_uid.caption: Event UID
event_uid.description: The unique identifier of the event assigned by the logger.

log_level.caption: Log Level
log_level.description: The audit level at which an event was generated.

log_name.caption: Log Name
log_name.description: The event log name. For example, syslog file name or Windows logging subsystem: Security.

log_provider.caption: Log Provider
log_provider.description: The logging provider or logging service that logged the event. For example, Microsoft-Windows-Security-Auditing.

log_version.caption: Log Version
log_version.description: The event log schema version that specifies the format of the original event. For example syslog version or Cisco Log Schema Version.

logged_time.caption: Logged Time
logged_time.description:
The time when the logging system collected and logged the event.

This attribute is distinct from the event time in that event time typically contain the time extracted from the original event. Most of the time, these two times will be different.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the logging product instance.

product.caption: Product
product.description: The product logging the event.  This may be the event source product, a management server product, a scanning product, a SIEM, etc.

transmit_time.caption: Transmission Time
transmit_time.description: The time when the event was transmitted from the logging device to it's next destination.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the logging product instance.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the logging product.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

logged_time_dt.caption: Logged Time
logged_time_dt.description:
The time when the logging system collected and logged the event.

This attribute is distinct from the event time in that event time typically contain the time extracted from the original event. Most of the time, these two times will be different.

transmit_time_dt.caption: Transmission Time
transmit_time_dt.description: The time when the event was transmitted from the logging device to it's next destination.

organization.caption: Organization
organization.name: organization
organization.description: The Organization object describes characteristics of an organization or company and its division if any. Additionally, it also describes cloud and Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) logical hierarchies such as AWS Organizations, Google Cloud Organizations, Oracle Cloud Tenancies, and similar constructs.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the organization, Oracle Cloud Tenancy, Google Cloud Organization, or AWS Organization. For example, Widget, Inc. or the AWS Organization name .

ou_name.caption: Org Unit Name
ou_name.description: The name of an organizational unit, Google Cloud Folder, or AWS Org Unit. For example, the GCP Project Name , or Dev_Prod_OU .

ou_uid.caption: Org Unit ID
ou_uid.description: The unique identifier of an organizational unit, Google Cloud Folder, or AWS Org Unit. For example, an Oracle Cloud Tenancy ID , AWS OU ID , or GCP Folder ID .

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the organization, Oracle Cloud Tenancy, Google Cloud Organization, or AWS Organization. For example, an AWS Org ID or Oracle Cloud Domain ID .

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

reputation.caption: Reputation
reputation.name: reputation
reputation.description: The Reputation object describes the reputation/risk score of an entity (e.g. device, user, domain).

base_score.caption: Reputation Score
base_score.description: The reputation score as reported by the event source.

provider.caption: Provider
provider.description: The provider of the reputation information.

score.caption: Reputation Score
score.description: The reputation score, normalized to the caption of the score_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

1.caption: Very Safe
1.description: Long history of good behavior.

2.caption: Safe
2.description: Consistently good behavior.

3.caption: Probably Safe
3.description: Reasonable history of good behavior.

4.caption: Leans Safe
4.description: Starting to establish a history of normal behavior.

5.caption: May not be Safe
5.description: No established history of normal behavior.

6.caption: Exercise Caution
6.description: Starting to establish a history of suspicious or risky behavior.

7.caption: Suspicious/Risky
7.description: A site with a history of suspicious or risky behavior. (spam, scam, potentially unwanted software, potentially malicious).

8.caption: Possibly Malicious
8.description: Strong possibility of maliciousness.

9.caption: Probably Malicious
9.description: Indicators of maliciousness.

10.caption: Malicious
10.description: Proven evidence of maliciousness.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The reputation score is not mapped. See the rep_score attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

unmanned_system_operating_area.caption: Unmanned System Operating Area
unmanned_system_operating_area.name: unmanned_system_operating_area
unmanned_system_operating_area.description: The Unmanned System Operating Area object describes details about a precise area of operations for a UAS flight or mission.

altitude_ceiling.caption: Altitude Ceiling
altitude_ceiling.description: Maximum altitude (WGS-84 HAE) for a group or an Intent-Based Network Participant. Measured in meters. Special Values: Invalid, No Value, or Unknown: -1000 m.

altitude_floor.caption: Altitude Floor
altitude_floor.description: Minimum altitude (WGS-84 HAE) for a group or an Intent-Based Network Participant. Measured in meters. Special Values: Invalid, No Value, or Unknown: -1000 m.

count.caption: Count
count.description: Indicates the number of UAS in the operating area.

end_time.caption: End Time
end_time.description: The date and time at which a group or an Intent-Based Network Participant operation ends. (This field is only applicable to Network Remote ID.)

locations.caption: Operating Polygon
locations.description: A list of Position Location Information (PLI) (latitude/longitude pairs) defining the area where a group or Intent-Based Network Participant operation is taking place. (This field is only applicable to Network Remote ID.)

radius.caption: Operating Area Radius
radius.description: Farthest horizontal distance from the reported location at which any UA in a group may be located (meters). Also allows defining the area where an Intent-Based Network Participant operation is taking place. Default: 0 m.

start_time.caption: Start Time
start_time.description: The date and time at which a group or an Intent-Based Network Participant operation starts. (This field is only applicable to Network Remote ID.)

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of operating area. For example, Takeoff Location, Fixed Location, Dynamic Location.

0.caption: Unknown/Undeclared
0.description: The UA type is empty or not declared.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

aerial_height.caption: Aerial Height
aerial_height.description: Expressed as either height above takeoff location or height above ground level (AGL) for a UAS current location. This value is provided in meters and must have a minimum resolution of 1 m. Special Values: Invalid, No Value, or Unknown: -1000 m.

coordinates.caption: Coordinates
coordinates.description: A two-element array, containing a longitude/latitude pair. The format conforms with GeoJSON. For example: [-73.983, 40.719].

country.caption: Country
country.description:
The ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 country code.

Note: The two letter country code should be capitalized. For example: US or CA.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the geographical location.

geodetic_altitude.caption: Geodetic Altitude
geodetic_altitude.description: The aircraft distance above or below the ellipsoid as measured along a line that passes through the aircraft and is normal to the surface of the WGS-84 ellipsoid. This value is provided in meters and must have a minimum resolution of 1 m. Special Values: Invalid, No Value, or Unknown: -1000 m.

geodetic_vertical_accuracy.caption: Geodetic Vertical Accuracy
geodetic_vertical_accuracy.description: Provides quality/containment on geodetic altitude. This is based on ADS-B Geodetic Vertical Accuracy (GVA). Measured in meters.

geohash.caption: Geohash
geohash.description:
Geohash of the geo-coordinates (latitude and longitude).

Geohashing is a geocoding system used to encode geographic coordinates in decimal degrees, to a single string.

horizontal_accuracy.caption: Horizontal Accuracy
horizontal_accuracy.description: Provides quality/containment on horizontal position. This is based on ADS-B NACp. Measured in meters.

is_on_premises.caption: On Premises
is_on_premises.description: The indication of whether the location is on premises.

isp.caption: ISP
isp.description: The name of the Internet Service Provider (ISP).

lat.caption: Latitude
lat.description: The geographical Latitude coordinate represented in Decimal Degrees (DD). For example: 42.361145.

long.caption: Longitude
long.description: The geographical Longitude coordinate represented in Decimal Degrees (DD). For example: -71.057083.

postal_code.caption: Postal Code
postal_code.description: The postal code of the location.

pressure_altitude.caption: Pressure Altitude
pressure_altitude.description: The uncorrected barometric pressure altitude (based on reference standard 29.92 inHg, 1013.25 mb) provides a reference for algorithms that utilize 'altitude deltas' between aircraft. This value is provided in meters and must have a minimum resolution of 1 m.. Special Values: Invalid, No Value, or Unknown: -1000 m.

provider.caption: Provider
provider.description: The provider of the geographical location data.

region.caption: Region
region.description: The alphanumeric code that identifies the principal subdivision (e.g. province or state) of the country. For example, 'CH-VD' for the Canton of Vaud, Switzerland

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

end_time_dt.caption: End Time
end_time_dt.description: The date and time at which a group or an Intent-Based Network Participant operation ends. (This field is only applicable to Network Remote ID.)

start_time_dt.caption: Start Time
start_time_dt.description: The date and time at which a group or an Intent-Based Network Participant operation starts. (This field is only applicable to Network Remote ID.)

dce_rpc.caption: DCE/RPC
dce_rpc.name: dce_rpc
dce_rpc.description: The DCE/RPC, or Distributed Computing Environment/Remote Procedure Call, object describes the remote procedure call system for distributed computing environments.

command_response.caption: Command Response
command_response.description: The reply to the request command (e.g. RESPONSE, BINDACK or FAULT).

opnum.caption: Opnum
opnum.description: An operation number used to identify a specific remote procedure call (RPC) method or a method in an interface.

rpc_interface.caption: Remote Procedure Call Interface
rpc_interface.description: The RPC Interface object describes the details pertaining to the remote procedure call interface.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

finding.caption: Finding
finding.name: finding
finding.description: The Finding object describes metadata related to a security finding generated by a security tool or system.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the finding was created.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the reported finding.

first_seen_time.caption: First Seen
first_seen_time.description: The time when the finding was first observed.

last_seen_time.caption: Last Seen
last_seen_time.description: The time when the finding was most recently observed.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The time when the finding was last modified.

product.caption: Product
product.description: Details about the product that reported the finding.

product_uid.caption: Product Identifier
product_uid.description: The unique identifier of the product that reported the finding.

@deprecated.message: Use the uid attribute in the product object instead. See specific usage.

related_events.caption: Related Events/Findings
related_events.description: Describes events and/or other findings related to the finding as identified by the security product. Note that these events may or may not be in OCSF.

remediation.caption: Remediation Guidance
remediation.description: Describes the recommended remediation steps to address identified issue(s).

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The URL pointing to the source of the finding.

supporting_data.caption: Supporting Data
supporting_data.description: Additional data supporting a finding as provided by security tool

title.caption: Title
title.description: A title or a brief phrase summarizing the reported finding.

types.caption: Types
types.description: One or more types of the reported finding.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the reported finding.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the finding was created.

first_seen_time_dt.caption: First Seen
first_seen_time_dt.description: The time when the finding was first observed.

last_seen_time_dt.caption: Last Seen
last_seen_time_dt.description: The time when the finding was most recently observed.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The time when the finding was last modified.

module.caption: Module
module.name: module
module.description: The Module object describes the load attributes of a module.

base_address.caption: Base Address
base_address.description: The memory address where the module was loaded.

file.caption: File
file.description: The module file object.

function_name.caption: Function Name
function_name.description: The entry-point function of the module. The system calls the entry-point function whenever a process or thread loads or unloads the module.

load_type.caption: Load Type
load_type.description: The load type, normalized to the caption of the load_type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

load_type_id.caption: Load Type ID
load_type_id.description: The normalized identifier for how the module was loaded in memory.

1.caption: Standard
1.description: A normal module loaded by the normal windows loading mechanism i.e. LoadLibrary.

2.caption: Non Standard
2.description: A module loaded in a way avoidant of normal windows procedures. i.e. Bootstrapped Loading/Manual Dll Loading.

3.caption: ShellCode
3.description: A raw module in process memory that is READWRITE_EXECUTE and had a thread started in its range.

4.caption: Mapped
4.description: A memory mapped file, typically created with CreatefileMapping/MapViewOfFile.

5.caption: NonStandard Backed
5.description: A module loaded in a non standard way. However, GetModuleFileName succeeds on this allocation.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The load type is not mapped. See the load_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

start_address.caption: Start Address
start_address.description: The start address of the execution.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The module type.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

auth_factor.caption: Authentication Factor
auth_factor.name: auth_factor
auth_factor.description: An Authentication Factor object describes a category of methods used for identity verification in an authentication attempt.

device.caption: Device
device.description: Device used to complete an authentication request.

email_addr.caption: Email Address
email_addr.description: The email address used in an email-based authentication factor.

factor_type.caption: Factor Type
factor_type.description: The type of authentication factor used in an authentication attempt.

factor_type_id.caption: Factor Type ID
factor_type_id.description: The normalized identifier for the authentication factor.

1.caption: SMS
1.description: User receives and inputs a code sent to their mobile device via SMS text message.

2.caption: Security Question
2.description: The user responds to a security question as part of a question-based authentication factor

3.caption: Phone Call
3.description: System calls the user's registered phone number and requires the user to answer and provide a response.

4.caption: Biometric
4.description: Devices that verify identity-based on user's physical identifiers, such as fingerprint scanners or retina scanners.

5.caption: Push Notification
5.description: Push notification is sent to user's registered device and requires the user to acknowledge.

6.caption: Hardware Token
6.description: Physical device that generates a code to be used for authentication.

7.caption: OTP
7.description: Application generates a one-time password (OTP) for use in authentication.

8.caption: Email
8.description: A code or link is sent to a user's registered email address.

9.caption: U2F
9.description: Typically involves a hardware token, which the user physically interacts with to authenticate.

10.caption: WebAuthn
10.description: Web-based API that enables users to register devices as authentication factors.

11.caption: Password
11.description: The user enters a password that they have previously established.

is_hotp.caption: HMAC-based One-time Password (HOTP)
is_hotp.description: Whether the authentication factor is an HMAC-based One-time Password (HOTP).

is_totp.caption: Time-based One-time Password (TOTP)
is_totp.description: Whether the authentication factor is a Time-based One-time Password (TOTP).

phone_number.caption: Phone Number
phone_number.description: The phone number used for a telephony-based authentication request.

provider.caption: Provider
provider.description: The name of provider for an authentication factor.

security_questions.caption: Security Questions
security_questions.description: The question(s) provided to user for a question-based authentication factor.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

observable.caption: Observable
observable.name: observable
observable.description: The observable object is a pivot element that contains related information found in many places in the event.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The full name of the observable attribute. The name is a pointer/reference to an attribute within the OCSF event data. For example: file.name.

reputation.caption: Reputation Scores
reputation.description: Contains the original and normalized reputation scores.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The observable value type name.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The observable data type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which may contain data source specific value.

13.caption: Command Line
13.description:
Observable by Dictionary Attribute.
The full command line used to launch an application, service, process, or job. For example: ssh user@10.0.0.10. If the command line is unavailable or missing, the empty string '' is to be used.

14.caption: Country
14.description:
Observable by Dictionary Attribute.
The ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 country code.

Note: The two letter country code should be capitalized. For example: US or CA.

19.caption: User Credential ID
19.description:
Observable by Dictionary Attribute.
The unique identifier of the user's credential. For example, AWS Access Key ID.

15.caption: Process ID
15.description:
Observable by Dictionary Attribute.
The process identifier, as reported by the operating system. Process ID (PID) is a number used by the operating system to uniquely identify an active process.

36.caption: Script Content
36.description:
Observable by Dictionary Attribute.
The script content, normalized to UTF-8 encoding irrespective of its original encoding. When emitting this attribute, it may be appropriate to truncate large scripts. When consuming this attribute, large scripts should be anticipated.

37.caption: Serial Number
37.description:
Observable by Dictionary Attribute.
The serial number that pertains to the object. See specific usage.

16.caption: HTTP User-Agent
16.description:
Observable by Dictionary Attribute.
The request header that identifies the operating system and web browser.

5.caption: Email Address
5.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
Email address. For example:
john_doe@example.com.

8.caption: Hash
8.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
Hash. A unique value that corresponds to the content of the file, image, ja3_hash or hassh found in the schema. For example:
MD5: 3172ac7e2b55cbb81f04a6e65855a628.

7.caption: File Name
7.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
File name. For example:
text-file.txt.

1.caption: Hostname
1.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
Unique name assigned to a device connected to a computer network. It may be a fully qualified domain name (FQDN). For example:
r2-d2.example.com.,
mx.example.com

2.caption: IP Address
2.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
Internet Protocol address (IP address), in either IPv4 or IPv6 format. For example:
192.168.200.24,
2001:0db8:85a3:0000:0000:8a2e:0370:7334.

3.caption: MAC Address
3.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
Media Access Control (MAC) address. For example:
18:36:F3:98:4F:9A.

11.caption: Port
11.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
The TCP/UDP port number. For example:
80,
22.

9.caption: Process Name
9.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
Process name. For example:
Notepad.

10.caption: Resource UID
10.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
Resource unique identifier. For example, S3 Bucket name or EC2 Instance ID.

12.caption: Subnet
12.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
The subnet represented in a CIDR notation, using the format network_address/prefix_length. The network_address can be in either IPv4 or IPv6 format. The prefix length indicates the number of bits used for the network portion, and the remaining bits are available for host addresses within that subnet. For example:
192.168.1.0/24,
2001:0db8:85a3:0000::/64

6.caption: URL String
6.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
Uniform Resource Locator (URL) string. For example:
http://www.example.com/download/trouble.exe.

4.caption: User Name
4.description:
Observable by Dictionary Type.
User name. For example:
john_doe.

18.caption: CVE Object: uid
18.description:
Observable by Object-Specific Attribute.
Object-specific attribute "uid" for the CVE Object.

38.caption: Databucket Object: name
38.description:
Observable by Object-Specific Attribute.
Object-specific attribute "name" for the Databucket Object.

26.caption: Geo Location
26.description:
Observable by Object.
The Geo Location object describes a geographical location, usually associated with an IP address.

20.caption: Endpoint
20.description:
Observable by Object.
The Endpoint object describes a physical or virtual device that connects to and exchanges information with a computer network. Some examples of endpoints are mobile devices, desktop computers, virtual machines, embedded devices, and servers. Internet-of-Things devices—like cameras, lighting, refrigerators, security systems, smart speakers, and thermostats—are also endpoints.

24.caption: File
24.description:
Observable by Object.
The File object represents the metadata associated with a file stored in a computer system. It encompasses information about the file itself, including its attributes, properties, and organizational details.

30.caption: Fingerprint
30.description:
Observable by Object.
The Fingerprint object provides detailed information about a digital fingerprint, which is a compact representation of data used to identify a longer piece of information, such as a public key or file content. It contains the algorithm and value of the fingerprint, enabling efficient and reliable identification of the associated data.

17.caption: CWE Object: uid
17.description:
Observable by Object-Specific Attribute.
Object-specific attribute "uid" for the CWE Object.

27.caption: Container
27.description:
Observable by Object.
The Container object describes an instance of a specific container. A container is a prepackaged, portable system image that runs isolated on an existing system using a container runtime like containerd.

34.caption: Account Object: name
34.description:
Observable by Object-Specific Attribute.
Object-specific attribute "name" for the Account Object.

35.caption: Account Object: uid
35.description:
Observable by Object-Specific Attribute.
Object-specific attribute "uid" for the Account Object.

21.caption: User
21.description:
Observable by Object.
The User object describes the characteristics of a user/person or a security principal.

31.caption: User Object: uid
31.description:
Observable by Object-Specific Attribute.
Object-specific attribute "uid" for the User Object.

23.caption: Uniform Resource Locator
23.description:
Observable by Object.
The Uniform Resource Locator (URL) object describes the characteristics of a URL.

22.caption: Email
22.description:
Observable by Object.
The Email object describes the email metadata such as sender, recipients, and direction, and can include embedded URLs and files.

25.caption: Process
25.description:
Observable by Object.
The Process object describes a running instance of a launched program.

32.caption: Group Object: name
32.description:
Observable by Object-Specific Attribute.
Object-specific attribute "name" for the Group Object.

33.caption: Group Object: uid
33.description:
Observable by Object-Specific Attribute.
Object-specific attribute "uid" for the Group Object.

28.caption: Registry Key
28.description:
Observable by Object.
The registry key object describes a Windows registry key.

29.caption: Registry Value
29.description:
Observable by Object.
The registry value object describes a Windows registry value.

value.caption: Value
value.description:
The value associated with the observable attribute. The meaning of the value depends on the observable type.
If the name refers to a scalar attribute, then the value is the value of the attribute.
If the name refers to an object attribute, then the value is not populated.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

cis_control.caption: CIS Control
cis_control.name: cis_control
cis_control.description: The CIS Control (aka Critical Security Control) object describes a prioritized set of actions to protect your organization and data from cyber-attack vectors. The CIS Controls are defined by the Center for Internet Security.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The CIS Control description. For example: Uninstall or disable unnecessary services on enterprise assets and software, such as an unused file sharing service, web application module, or service function.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The CIS Control name. For example: 4.8 Uninstall or Disable Unnecessary Services on Enterprise Assets and Software.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The CIS Control version. For example: v8.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

email.caption: Email
email.name: email
email.description: The Email object describes the email metadata such as sender, recipients, and direction, and can include embedded URLs and files.

cc.caption: Cc
cc.description: The machine-readable email header Cc values, as defined by RFC 5322. For example example.user@usersdomain.com.

cc_mailboxes.caption: Cc Mailboxes
cc_mailboxes.description: The human-readable email header Cc Mailbox values. For example 'Example User <example.user@usersdomain.com>'.

delivered_to.caption: Delivered To
delivered_to.description: The machine-readable Delivered-To email header field. For example example.user@usersdomain.com

delivered_to_list.caption: Delivered To
delivered_to_list.description: The machine-readable Delivered-To email header values. For example example.user@usersdomain.com

files.caption: Files
files.description: The files embedded or attached to the email.

from.caption: From
from.description: The machine-readable email header From values, as defined by RFC 5322. For example example.user@usersdomain.com

from_mailbox.caption: From Mailbox
from_mailbox.description: The human-readable email header From Mailbox value. For example 'Example User <example.user@usersdomain.com>'.

http_headers.caption: HTTP Headers
http_headers.description: Additional HTTP headers of an HTTP request or response.

message_uid.caption: Message UID
message_uid.description: The email header Message-ID value, as defined by RFC 5322.

reply_to.caption: Reply To
reply_to.description: The machine-readable email header Reply-To values, as defined by RFC 5322. For example example.user@usersdomain.com

reply_to_mailboxes.caption: Reply To Mailboxes
reply_to_mailboxes.description: The human-readable email header Reply To Mailbox values. For example 'Example User <example.user@usersdomain.com>'.

size.caption: Size
size.description: The size in bytes of the email, including attachments.

smtp_from.caption: SMTP From
smtp_from.description: The value of the SMTP MAIL FROM command.

smtp_to.caption: SMTP To
smtp_to.description: The value of the SMTP envelope RCPT TO command.

subject.caption: Subject
subject.description: The email header Subject value, as defined by RFC 5322.

to.caption: To
to.description: The machine-readable email header To values, as defined by RFC 5322. For example example.user@usersdomain.com

to_mailboxes.caption: To Mailboxes
to_mailboxes.description: The human-readable email header To Mailbox values. For example 'Example User <example.user@usersdomain.com>'.

uid.caption: Email Thread UID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the email thread.

urls.caption: URLs
urls.description: The URLs embedded in the email.

x_originating_ip.caption: X-Originating-IP
x_originating_ip.description: The X-Originating-IP header identifying the emails originating IP address(es).

data_classification.caption: Data Classification
data_classification.description: The Data Classification object includes information about data classification levels and data category types.

data_classifications.caption: Data Classification
data_classifications.description: A list of Data Classification objects, that include information about data classification levels and data category types, indentified by a classifier.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

sender_users.caption: Sender Users
sender_users.description: The user who sent the email

startup_item.caption: Startup Item
startup_item.name: startup_item
startup_item.description: The startup item object describes an application component that has associated startup criteria and configurations.

driver.caption: Kernel Driver
driver.description: The startup item kernel driver resource.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The unique name of the startup item.

run_mode_ids.caption: Run Mode IDs
run_mode_ids.description: The list of normalized identifiers that describe the startup items' properties when it is running.  Use this field to capture extended information about the process, which may depend on the type of startup item.  E.g., A Windows service that interacts with the desktop.

1.caption: Interactive
1.description: The startup item interacts with the desktop.

2.caption: Own Process
2.description: The startup item runs in its own process.

3.caption: Shared Process
3.description: The startup item runs in a shared process.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The run mode is not mapped. See the run_modes attribute, which contains data source specific values.

run_modes.caption: Run Modes
run_modes.description: The list of run_modes, normalized to the captions of the run_mode_id values.  In the case of 'Other', they are defined by the event source.

run_state.caption: Run State
run_state.description: The run state of the startup item.

run_state_id.caption: Run State ID
run_state_id.description: The run state ID of the startup item.

1.caption: Stopped
1.description: The service is not running.

2.caption: Start Pending
2.description: The service is starting.

3.caption: Stop Pending
3.description: The service is stopping.

4.caption: Running
4.description: The service is running.

5.caption: Continue Pending
5.description: The service is pending continue.

6.caption: Pause Pending
6.description: The service is pending pause.

7.caption: Paused
7.description: The service is paused.

8.caption: Restart Pending
8.description: The service is pending restart.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The run state is not mapped. See the run_state attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

start_type.caption: Start Type
start_type.description: The start type of the startup item.

start_type_id.caption: Start Type ID
start_type_id.description: The start type ID of the startup item.

1.caption: Auto
1.description: Service started automatically during system startup.

2.caption: Boot
2.description: Device driver started by the system loader.

3.caption: On Demand
3.description: Started on demand. For example, by the Windows Service Control Manager when a process calls the StartService function.

4.caption: Disabled
4.description: The service is disabled, and cannot be started.

5.caption: All Logins
5.description: Started on all user logins.

6.caption: Specific User Login
6.description: Started on specific user logins.

7.caption: Scheduled
7.description: Stared according to a schedule.

8.caption: System Changed
8.description: Started when a system item, such as a file or registry key, changes.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The start type is not mapped. See the start_type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The startup item type.

1.caption: Kernel Mode Driver
1.description: Kernel mode driver.

2.caption: User Mode Driver
2.description: User mode driver.

3.caption: Service
3.description: A background process typically managed by the operating system, e.g., a service process on Windows or a systemd-managed daemon on Linux.

4.caption: User Mode Application
4.description: An application that runs in the user space.

5.caption: Autoload
5.description: The macOS Autoload Application.

6.caption: System Extension
6.description: System extensions on macOS enables 3rd parties to extend the capabilities of macOS.

7.caption: Kernel Extension
7.description: Kernel extensions on macOS includes Apple provided pre-installs and 3rd party installs which enables support for specific hardware or software features not natively supported by macOS.

8.caption: Scheduled Job, Task
8.description: A job or task that runs on a configured schedule.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The startup item type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains data source specific values.

win_service.caption: Windows Service
win_service.description: The startup item Windows service resource.

hassh.caption: HASSH
hassh.name: hassh
hassh.description: The HASSH object contains SSH network fingerprinting values for specific client/server implementations. It provides a standardized way of identifying and categorizing SSH connections based on their unique characteristics and behavior.

algorithm.caption: Algorithm
algorithm.description: The concatenation of key exchange, encryption, authentication and compression algorithms (separated by ';'). NOTE: This is not the underlying algorithm for the hash implementation.

fingerprint.caption: Fingerprint
fingerprint.description: The hash of the key exchange, encryption, authentication and compression algorithms.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

process.caption: Process
process.name: process
process.description: The Process object describes a running instance of a launched program.

ancestry.caption: Ancestry
ancestry.description: An array of Process Entities describing the extended parentage of this process object. Direct parent information sould be expressed through the parent_process attribute. The first array element is the direct parent of this process object. Subsequent list elements go up the process parentage hierarchy. That is, the array is sorted from newest to oldest process. It is recommended to only populate this field for the top-level process object.

environment_variables.caption: Environment Variables
environment_variables.description: Environment variables associated with the process.

file.caption: File
file.description: The process file object.

integrity.caption: Integrity
integrity.description: The process integrity level, normalized to the caption of the integrity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source (Windows only).

integrity_id.caption: Integrity Level
integrity_id.description: The normalized identifier of the process integrity level (Windows only).

99.caption: Other
99.description: The integrity level is not mapped. See the integrity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

lineage.caption: Lineage
lineage.description: The lineage of the process, represented by a list of paths for each ancestor process. For example: ['/usr/sbin/sshd', '/usr/bin/bash', '/usr/bin/whoami'].

loaded_modules.caption: Loaded Modules
loaded_modules.description: The list of loaded module names.

parent_process.caption: Parent Process
parent_process.description: The parent process of this process object. It is recommended to only populate this field for the top-level process object, to prevent deep nesting. Additional ancestry information can be supplied in the ancestry attribute.

sandbox.caption: Sandbox
sandbox.description: The name of the containment jail (i.e., sandbox). For example, hardened_ps, high_security_ps, oracle_ps, netsvcs_ps, or default_ps.

session.caption: Session
session.description: The user session under which this process is running.

terminated_time.caption: Terminated Time
terminated_time.description: The time when the process was terminated.

tid.caption: Thread ID
tid.description: The Identifier of the thread associated with the event, as returned by the operating system.

user.caption: User
user.description: The user under which this process is running.

working_directory.caption: Working Directory
working_directory.description: The working directory of a process.

xattributes.caption: Extended Attributes
xattributes.description: An unordered collection of zero or more name/value pairs that represent a process extended attribute.

container.caption: Container
container.description: The information describing an instance of a container. A container is a prepackaged, portable system image that runs isolated on an existing system using a container runtime like containerd.

namespace_pid.caption: Namespace PID
namespace_pid.description: If running under a process namespace (such as in a container), the process identifier within that process namespace.

cmd_line.caption: Command Line
cmd_line.description: The full command line used to launch an application, service, process, or job. For example: ssh user@10.0.0.10. If the command line is unavailable or missing, the empty string '' is to be used.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the process was created/started.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The friendly name of the process, for example: Notepad++.

pid.caption: Process ID
pid.description: The process identifier, as reported by the operating system. Process ID (PID) is a number used by the operating system to uniquely identify an active process.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: A unique identifier for this process assigned by the producer (tool).  Facilitates correlation of a process event with other events for that process.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

auid.caption: Audit User ID
auid.description: The audit user assigned at login by the audit subsystem.

egid.caption: Effective Group ID
egid.description: The effective group under which this process is running.

euid.caption: Effective User ID
euid.description: The effective user under which this process is running.

group.caption: Group
group.description: The group under which this process is running.

terminated_time_dt.caption: Terminated Time
terminated_time_dt.description: The time when the process was terminated.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the process was created/started.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the environment variable.

value.caption: Value
value.description: The value of the environment variable.

raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

name.description: Name of SAN (e.g. The actual IP Address or domain.)

type.caption: Type
type.description: Type descriptor of SAN (e.g. IP Address/domain/etc.)

unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

group.caption: Group
group.name: group
group.description: The Group object represents a collection or association of entities, such as users, policies, or devices. It serves as a logical grouping mechanism to organize and manage entities with similar characteristics or permissions within a system or organization, including but not limited to purposes of access control.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The group description.

domain.caption: Domain
domain.description: The domain where the group is defined. For example: the LDAP or Active Directory domain.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The group name.

type.caption: Account Type
type.description: The type of the group or account.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the group. For example, for Windows events this is the security identifier (SID) of the group.

raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

long_string.caption: Long String
long_string.name: long_string
long_string.description: This object is a used to capture strings which may be truncated by a security product due to their length.

is_truncated.caption: Is Truncated
is_truncated.description: Indicates that value has been truncated. May be omitted if truncation has not occurred.

untruncated_size.caption: Untruncated Size
untruncated_size.description: The size in bytes of the string represented by value before truncation. Should be omitted if truncation has not occurred.

value.caption: Value
value.description: The string value, truncated if is_truncated is true.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

response.name: response

code.caption: Response Code
code.description: The numeric response sent to a request.

containers.caption: Containers
containers.description: When working with containerized applications, the set of containers which write to the standard the output of a particular logging driver. For example, this may be the set of containers involved in handling api requests and responses for a containerized application.

data.caption: Data
data.description: The additional data that is associated with the api response.

flags.caption: Flags
flags.description: The communication flags that are associated with the api response.

message.caption: Message
message.description: The description of the event/finding, as defined by the source.

raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

product.caption: Product
product.name: product
product.description: The Product object describes characteristics of a software product.

cpe_name.caption: The product CPE identifier
cpe_name.description: The Common Platform Enumeration (CPE) name as described by (NIST) For example: cpe:/a:apple:safari:16.2.

feature.caption: Feature
feature.description: The feature that reported the event.

lang.caption: Language
lang.description: The two letter lower case language codes, as defined by ISO 639-1. For example: en (English), de (German), or fr (French).

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the product.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The installation path of the product.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the product.

url_string.caption: URL String
url_string.description: The URL pointing towards the product.

vendor_name.caption: Vendor Name
vendor_name.description: The name of the vendor of the product.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The version of the product, as defined by the event source. For example: 2013.1.3-beta.

data_classification.description: The Data Classification object includes information about data classification levels and data category types.

data_classifications.caption: Data Classification
data_classifications.description: A list of Data Classification objects, that include information about data classification levels and data category types, indentified by a classifier.

raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

kb_article.caption: KB Article
kb_article.name: kb_article
kb_article.description: The KB Article object contains metadata that describes the patch or update.

classification.caption: Classification
classification.description: The vendors classification of the kb article.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The date the kb article was released by the vendor.

install_state.caption: Install State
install_state.description: The install state of the kb article.

install_state_id.caption: Install State ID
install_state_id.description: The normalized install state ID of the kb article.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The normalized install state is unknown.

1.caption: Installed
1.description: The item is installed.

2.caption: Not Installed
2.description: The item is not installed.

3.caption: Installed Pending Reboot
3.description: The item is installed pending reboot operation.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The install state is not mapped. See the install_state attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

is_superseded.caption: The patch is superseded.
is_superseded.description: The kb article has been replaced by another.

os.caption: OS
os.description: The operating system the kb article applies.

product.caption: Product
product.description: The product details the kb article applies.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The severity of the kb article.

size.caption: Size
size.description: The size in bytes for the kb article.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The kb article link from the source vendor.

title.caption: Title
title.description: The title of the kb article.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier for the kb article.

unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.
