created_time_dt.description: The date the kb article was released by the vendor.

enrichment.caption: Enrichment
enrichment.name: enrichment
enrichment.description: The Enrichment object provides inline enrichment data for specific attributes of interest within an event. It serves as a mechanism to enhance or supplement the information associated with the event by adding additional relevant details or context.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the enrichment data was generated.

data.caption: Data
data.description: The enrichment data associated with the attribute and value. The meaning of this data depends on the type the enrichment record.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: A long description of the enrichment data.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the attribute to which the enriched data pertains.

reputation.caption: Reputation Scores
reputation.description: The reputation of the enrichment data.

short_desc.caption: Short Description
short_desc.description: A short description of the enrichment data.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The URL of the source of the enrichment data.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The enrichment type. For example: location.

value.caption: Value
value.description: The value of the attribute to which the enriched data pertains.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the enrichment data was generated.

related_event.caption: Related Event/Finding
related_event.name: related_event
related_event.description: The Related Event object describes an event or another finding related to a finding. It may or may not be an OCSF event.

attacks.caption: MITRE ATT&CK® Details
attacks.description: An array of MITRE ATT&CK® objects describing identified tactics, techniques & sub-techniques.

count.caption: Count
count.description: The number of times that activity in the same logical group occurred, as reported by the related Finding.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the related event/finding was created.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: A description of the related event/finding.

first_seen_time.caption: First Seen
first_seen_time.description:
The time when the finding was first observed. e.g. The time when a vulnerability was first observed.
It can differ from the created_time timestamp, which reflects the time this finding was created.

kill_chain.caption: Kill Chain
kill_chain.description: The Cyber Kill Chain® provides a detailed description of each phase and its associated activities within the broader context of a cyber attack.

last_seen_time.caption: Last Seen
last_seen_time.description:
The time when the finding was most recently observed. e.g. The time when a vulnerability was most recently observed.
It can differ from the modified_time timestamp, which reflects the time this finding was last modified.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The time when the related event/finding was last modified.

observables.caption: Observables
observables.description: The observables associated with the event or a finding.

product.caption: Product
product.description: Details about the product that reported the related event/finding.

product_uid.caption: Product Identifier
product_uid.description: The unique identifier of the product that reported the related event.

@deprecated.message: Use the uid attribute in the product object instead. See specific usage.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The event/finding severity, normalized to the caption of the severity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

severity_id.caption: Severity ID
severity_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the event/finding severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.

1.caption: Informational
1.description: Informational message. No action required.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

4.caption: High
4.description: Action is required immediately.

5.caption: Critical
5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

6.caption: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event/finding severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

tags.caption: Tags
tags.description: The list of tags; {key:value} pairs associated with the related event/finding.

title.caption: Title
title.description: A title or a brief phrase summarizing the related event/finding.

type.caption: Type
type.description:
The type of the related event/finding.

Populate if the related event/finding is NOT in OCSF. If it is in OCSF, then utilize type_name, type_uid instead.

type_name.caption: Type Name
type_name.description:
The type of the related OCSF event, as defined by type_uid.

For example: Process Activity: Launch.

Populate if the related event/finding is in OCSF.

type_uid.caption: Type ID
type_uid.description:
The unique identifier of the related OCSF event type.

For example: 100701.

Populate if the related event/finding is in OCSF.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description:
The unique identifier of the related event/finding.

If the related event/finding is in OCSF, then this value must be equal to metadata.uid in the corresponding event.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the related event/finding was created.

first_seen_time_dt.caption: First Seen
first_seen_time_dt.description:
The time when the finding was first observed. e.g. The time when a vulnerability was first observed.
It can differ from the created_time timestamp, which reflects the time this finding was created.

last_seen_time_dt.caption: Last Seen
last_seen_time_dt.description:
The time when the finding was most recently observed. e.g. The time when a vulnerability was most recently observed.
It can differ from the modified_time timestamp, which reflects the time this finding was last modified.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The time when the related event/finding was last modified.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The type id of the scan.

2.caption: Scheduled
2.description: The scan was started based on scheduler.

3.caption: Updated Content
3.description: The scan was triggered by a content update.

4.caption: Quarantined Items
4.description: The scan was triggered by newly quarantined items.

6.caption: User Logon
6.description: The scan was started due to a user logon.

3.description: The contact information provided is for the domain technical lead.

4.caption: Billing
4.description: The contact information provided is for the domain billing lead.

5.caption: Abuse
5.description: The contact information provided is for the domain abuse contact.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the contact information, typically provided in WHOIS information.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

compliance.caption: Compliance
compliance.name: compliance
compliance.description: The Compliance object contains information about Industry and Regulatory Framework standards, controls and requirements.

assessments.caption: Related Assessments
assessments.description: A list of assessments associated with the compliance requirements evaluation

compliance_references.caption: Compliance Standard References
compliance_references.description: A list of reference KB articles that provide information to help organizations understand, interpret, and implement compliance standards. They provide guidance, best practices, and examples.

compliance_standards.caption: Compliance Standards: Details
compliance_standards.description: A list of established guidelines or criteria that define specific requirements an organization must follow.

control.caption: Security Control
control.description: A Control is prescriptive, prioritized, and simplified set of best practices that one can use to strengthen their cybersecurity posture. e.g. AWS SecurityHub Controls, CIS Controls.

control_parameters.caption: Control Parameters
control_parameters.description: The list of control parameters evaluated in a Compliance check.

requirements.caption: Compliance Requirements
requirements.description: A list of requirements associated to a specific control in an industry or regulatory framework. e.g. NIST.800-53.r5 AU-10

standards.caption: Compliance Standards: List
standards.description: Compliance standards are a set of criteria organizations can follow to protect sensitive and confidential information. e.g. NIST SP 800-53, CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark v1.4.0, ISO/IEC 27001

status.caption: Status
status.description: The resultant status of the compliance check normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

status_code.caption: Status Code
status_code.description: The resultant status code of the compliance check.

status_detail.caption: Status Detail
status_detail.description: The contextual description of the status, status_code values.

status_details.caption: Status Details
status_details.description: A list of contextual descriptions of the status, status_code values.

status_id.caption: Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized status identifier of the compliance check.

1.caption: Pass
1.description: The compliance check passed for all the evaluated resources.

2.caption: Warning
2.description: The compliance check did not yield a result due to missing information.

3.caption: Fail
3.description: The compliance check failed for at least one of the evaluated resources.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

sub_technique.caption: MITRE ATT&CK® Sub Technique
sub_technique.name: sub_technique
sub_technique.description: The MITRE ATT&CK® Sub Technique object describes the sub technique ID and/or name associated to an attack, as defined by ATT&CK® Matrix.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the attack sub technique, as defined by ATT&CK® Matrix. For example: Scanning IP Blocks.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The versioned permalink of the attack sub technique, as defined by ATT&CK® Matrix. For example: https://attack.mitre.org/versions/v14/techniques/T1595/001/.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the attack sub technique, as defined by ATT&CK® Matrix. For example: T1595.001.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

scim.caption: SCIM
scim.name: scim
scim.description: The System for Cross-domain Identity Management (SCIM) Configuration object provides a structured set of attributes related to SCIM protocols used for identity provisioning and management across cloud-based platforms. It standardizes user and group provisioning details, enabling identity synchronization and lifecycle management with compatible Identity Providers (IdPs) and applications. SCIM is defined in RFC-7634

auth_protocol.caption: Auth Protocol
auth_protocol.description: The authorization protocol as defined by the caption of auth_protocol_id. In the case of Other, it is defined by the event source.

auth_protocol_id.caption: Auth Protocol ID
auth_protocol_id.description: The normalized identifier of the authorization protocol used by the SCIM resource.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The authentication protocol is not mapped. See the auth_protocol attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: When the SCIM resource was added to the service provider.

error_message.caption: Last Error Message
error_message.description: Message or code associated with the last encountered error.

is_group_provisioning_enabled.caption: SCIM Group Provisioning Enabled
is_group_provisioning_enabled.description: Indicates whether the SCIM resource is configured to provision groups, automatically or otherwise.

is_user_provisioning_enabled.caption: SCIM User Provisioning Enabled
is_user_provisioning_enabled.description: Indicates whether the SCIM resource is configured to provision users, automatically or otherwise.

last_run_time.caption: Last Sync Time
last_run_time.description: Timestamp of the most recent successful synchronization.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The most recent time when the SCIM resource was updated at the service provider.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the SCIM resource.

protocol_name.caption: Supported Protocol
protocol_name.description: The supported protocol for the SCIM resource. E.g., SAML, OIDC, or OAuth2.

rate_limit.caption: Rate Limit
rate_limit.description: Maximum number of requests allowed by the SCIM resource within a specified time frame to avoid throttling.

scim_group_schema.caption: SCIM Group Schema
scim_group_schema.description: SCIM provides a schema for representing groups, identified using the following schema URI: urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:core:2.0:Group as defined in RFC-7634. This attribute will capture key-value pairs for the scheme implemented in a SCIM resource.

scim_user_schema.caption: SCIM User Schema
scim_user_schema.description: SCIM provides a resource type for user resources. The core schema for user is identified using the following schema URI: urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:core:2.0:User as defined in RFC-7634. his attribute will capture key-value pairs for the scheme implemented in a SCIM resource. This object is inclusive of both the basic and Enterprise User Schema Extension.

state.caption: State
state.description: The provisioning state of the SCIM resource, normalized to the caption of the state_id value. In the case of Other, it is defined by the event source.

state_id.caption: State ID
state_id.description: The normalized state ID of the SCIM resource to reflect its activation status.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The provisioning state of the SCIM resource is unknown.

1.caption: Pending
1.description: The SCIM resource is Pending activation or creation.

2.caption: Active
2.description: The SCIM resource is in an Active state, or otherwise enabled.

3.caption: Failed
3.description: The SCIM resource is in a Failed state.

4.caption: Deleted
4.description: The SCIM resource is in a Deleted state, or otherwise disabled.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The provisioning state of the SCIM resource is not mapped. See the state attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: A unique identifier for a SCIM resource as defined by the service provider.

uid_alt.caption: External ID
uid_alt.description: A String that is an identifier for the resource as defined by the provisioning client. The externalId may simplify identification of a resource between the provisioning client and the service provider by allowing the client to use a filter to locate the resource with an identifier from the provisioning domain, obviating the need to store a local mapping between the provisioning domain's identifier of the resource and the identifier used by the service provider.

url_string.caption: SCIM Endpoint URL
url_string.description: The primary URL for SCIM API requests.

vendor_name.caption: Service Provider
vendor_name.description: Name of the vendor or service provider implementing SCIM. E.g., Okta, Auth0, Microsoft.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: When the SCIM resource was added to the service provider.

last_run_time_dt.caption: Last Sync Time
last_run_time_dt.description: Timestamp of the most recent successful synchronization.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The most recent time when the SCIM resource was updated at the service provider.

image.caption: Image
image.name: image
image.description: The Image object provides a description of a specific Virtual Machine (VM) or Container image.

labels.caption: Labels
labels.description: The list of labels associated to the image.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The image name. For example: elixir.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The full path to the image file.

@deprecated.message: Use the labels or tags attribute instead.

tags.caption: Tags
tags.description: The list of tags; {key:value} pairs associated to the image.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique image ID. For example: 77af4d6b9913.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

extension.caption: Schema Extension
extension.name: extension
extension.description: The OCSF Schema Extension object provides detailed information about the schema extension used to construct the event. The schema extensions are registered in the extensions.md file.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The schema extension name. For example: dev.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The schema extension unique identifier. For example: 999.

version.caption: Version
version.description: The schema extension version. For example: 1.0.0-alpha.2.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

dns_answer.caption: DNS Answer
dns_answer.name: dns_answer
dns_answer.description: The DNS Answer object represents a specific response provided by the Domain Name System (DNS) when querying for information about a domain or performing a DNS operation. It encapsulates the relevant details and data returned by the DNS server in response to a query.

class.caption: Resource Record Class
class.description: The class of DNS data contained in this resource record. See RFC1035. For example: IN.

flag_ids.caption: DNS Header Flags
flag_ids.description: The list of DNS answer header flag IDs.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The flag is not mapped. See the flags attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

flags.caption: DNS Header Flags
flags.description: The list of DNS answer header flags.

rdata.caption: DNS RData
rdata.description: The data describing the DNS resource. The meaning of this data depends on the type and class of the resource record.

ttl.caption: TTL
ttl.description: The time interval that the resource record may be cached. Zero value means that the resource record can only be used for the transaction in progress, and should not be cached.

type.caption: Resource Record Type
type.description: The type of data contained in this resource record. See RFC1035. For example: CNAME.

packet_uid.caption: Packet UID
packet_uid.description: The DNS packet identifier assigned by the program that generated the query. The identifier is copied to the response.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

idp.caption: Identity Provider
idp.name: idp
idp.description: The Identity Provider object contains detailed information about a provider responsible for creating, maintaining, and managing identity information while offering authentication services to applications. An Identity Provider (IdP) serves as a trusted authority that verifies the identity of users and issues authentication tokens or assertions to enable secure access to applications or services.

auth_factors.caption: Authentication Factors
auth_factors.description: The Authentication Factors object describes the different types of Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) methods and/or devices supported by the Identity Provider.

domain.caption: Domain
domain.description: The primary domain associated with the Identity Provider.

fingerprint.caption: Certificate Fingerprint
fingerprint.description: The fingerprint of the X.509 certificate used by the Identity Provider.

has_mfa.caption: MFA Enforced
has_mfa.description: The Identity Provider enforces Multi Factor Authentication (MFA).

issuer.caption: Issuer Details
issuer.description: The unique identifier (often a URL) used by the Identity Provider as its issuer.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the Identity Provider.

protocol_name.caption: Supported Protocol
protocol_name.description: The supported protocol of the Identity Provider. E.g., SAML, OIDC, or OAuth2.

scim.caption: SCIM
scim.description: The System for Cross-domain Identity Management (SCIM) resource object provides a structured set of attributes related to SCIM protocols used for identity provisioning and management across cloud-based platforms. It standardizes user and group provisioning details, enabling identity synchronization and lifecycle management with compatible Identity Providers (IdPs) and applications. SCIM is defined in RFC-7634

sso.caption: SSO
sso.description: The Single Sign-On (SSO) object provides a structure for normalizing SSO attributes, configuration, and/or settings from Identity Providers.

state.caption: State
state.description: The configuration state of the Identity Provider, normalized to the caption of the state_id value. In the case of Other, it is defined by the event source.

state_id.caption: State ID
state_id.description: The normalized state ID of the Identity Provider to reflect its configuration or activation status.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The configuration state of the Identity Provider is unknown.

1.caption: Active
1.description: The Identity Provider is in an Active state, or otherwise enabled.

2.caption: Suspended
2.description: The Identity Provider is in a Suspended state.

3.caption: Deprecated
3.description: The Identity Provider is in a Deprecated state, or is otherwise disabled.

4.caption: Deleted
4.description: The Identity Provider is in a Deleted state.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The configuration state of the Identity Provider is not mapped. See the state attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

tenant_uid.caption: Tenant UID
tenant_uid.description: The tenant ID associated with the Identity Provider.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the Identity Provider.

url_string.caption: Configuration URL
url_string.description: The URL for accessing the configuration or metadata of the Identity Provider.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

network_endpoint.caption: Network Endpoint
network_endpoint.name: network_endpoint
network_endpoint.description: The Network Endpoint object describes characteristics of a network endpoint. These can be a source or destination of a network connection.

autonomous_system.caption: Autonomous System
autonomous_system.description: The Autonomous System details associated with an IP address.

intermediate_ips.caption: Intermediate IP Addresses
intermediate_ips.description: The intermediate IP Addresses. For example, the IP addresses in the HTTP X-Forwarded-For header.

port.caption: Port
port.description: The port used for communication within the network connection.

proxy_endpoint.caption: Proxy Endpoint
proxy_endpoint.description: The network proxy information pertaining to a specific endpoint. This can be used to describe information pertaining to network address translation (NAT).

svc_name.caption: Service Name
svc_name.description: The service name in service-to-service connections. For example, AWS VPC logs the pkt-src-aws-service and pkt-dst-aws-service fields identify the connection is coming from or going to an AWS service.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The network endpoint type. For example: unknown, server, desktop, laptop, tablet, mobile, virtual, browser, or other.

1.caption: Server
1.description: A server.

10.caption: Switch
10.description: A networking switch.

11.caption: Hub
11.description: A networking hub.

12.caption: Router
12.description: A networking router.

13.caption: IDS
13.description: An intrusion detection system.

14.caption: IPS
14.description: An intrusion prevention system.

15.caption: Load Balancer
15.description: A <a target='_blank' href='https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Load_balancing_(computing)'> Load Balancer device.

2.caption: Desktop
2.description: A desktop computer.

3.caption: Laptop
3.description: A laptop computer.

4.caption: Tablet
4.description: A tablet computer.

5.caption: Mobile
5.description: A mobile phone.

6.caption: Virtual
6.description: A virtual machine.

7.caption: IOT
7.description: An IOT (Internet of Things) device.

8.caption: Browser
8.description: A web browser.

9.caption: Firewall
9.description: A networking firewall.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

agent_list.caption: Agent List
agent_list.description: A list of agent objects associated with a device, endpoint, or resource.

domain.caption: Domain
domain.description: The name of the domain that the endpoint belongs to or that corresponds to the endpoint.

hostname.caption: Hostname
hostname.description: The fully qualified name of the endpoint.

instance_uid.caption: Instance ID
instance_uid.description: The unique identifier of a VM instance.

interface_name.caption: Network Interface Name
interface_name.description: The name of the network interface (e.g. eth2).

interface_uid.caption: Network Interface ID
interface_uid.description: The unique identifier of the network interface.

ip.caption: IP Address
ip.description: The IP address of the endpoint, in either IPv4 or IPv6 format.

location.caption: Geo Location
location.description: The geographical location of the endpoint.

mac.caption: MAC Address
mac.description: The Media Access Control (MAC) address of the endpoint.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The short name of the endpoint.

owner.caption: Owner
owner.description: The identity of the service or user account that owns the endpoint or was last logged into it.

subnet_uid.caption: Subnet UID
subnet_uid.description: The unique identifier of a virtual subnet.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the endpoint.

vpc_uid.caption: VPC UID
vpc_uid.description: The unique identifier of the Virtual Private Cloud (VPC).

zone.caption: Network Zone
zone.description: The network zone or LAN segment.

container.caption: Container
container.description: The information describing an instance of a container. A container is a prepackaged, portable system image that runs isolated on an existing system using a container runtime like containerd.

namespace_pid.caption: Namespace PID
namespace_pid.description: If running under a process namespace (such as in a container), the process identifier within that process namespace.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

ip_intelligence.caption: IP Intelligence
ip_intelligence.description: Insights from threat intelligence platforms about IP Address

finding_info.caption: Finding Information
finding_info.name: finding_info
finding_info.description: The Finding Information object describes metadata related to a security finding generated by a security tool or system.

analytic.caption: Analytic
analytic.description: The analytic technique used to analyze and derive insights from the data or information that led to the finding or conclusion.

attacks.caption: MITRE ATT&CK® Details
attacks.description: The MITRE ATT&CK® technique and associated tactics related to the finding.

created_time.caption: Created Time
created_time.description: The time when the finding was created.

data_sources.caption: Data Sources
data_sources.description: A list of data sources utilized in generation of the finding.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the reported finding.

first_seen_time.caption: First Seen
first_seen_time.description:
The time when the finding was first observed. e.g. The time when a vulnerability was first observed.

It can differ from the created_time timestamp, which reflects the time this finding was created.

kill_chain.caption: Kill Chain
kill_chain.description: The Cyber Kill Chain® provides a detailed description of each phase and its associated activities within the broader context of a cyber attack.

last_seen_time.caption: Last Seen
last_seen_time.description:
The time when the finding was most recently observed. e.g. The time when a vulnerability was most recently observed.

It can differ from the modified_time timestamp, which reflects the time this finding was last modified.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The time when the finding was last modified.

product.caption: Product
product.description: Details about the product that reported the finding.

product_uid.caption: Product Identifier
product_uid.description: The unique identifier of the product that reported the finding.

@deprecated.message: Use the uid attribute in the product object instead. See specific usage.

related_analytics.caption: Related Analytics
related_analytics.description: Other analytics related to this finding.

related_events.caption: Related Events/Findings
related_events.description: Describes events and/or other findings related to the finding as identified by the security product. Note that these events may or may not be in OCSF.

related_events_count.caption: Related Events/Findings Count
related_events_count.description: Number of related events or findings.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: The URL pointing to the source of the finding.

tags.caption: Tags
tags.description: The list of tags; {key:value} pairs associated with the finding.

title.caption: Title
title.description: A title or a brief phrase summarizing the reported finding.

types.caption: Types
types.description: One or more types of the reported finding.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the reported finding.

uid_alt.caption: Alternate ID
uid_alt.description: The alternative unique identifier of the reported finding.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

created_time_dt.caption: Created Time
created_time_dt.description: The time when the finding was created.

first_seen_time_dt.caption: First Seen
first_seen_time_dt.description:
The time when the finding was first observed. e.g. The time when a vulnerability was first observed.

It can differ from the created_time timestamp, which reflects the time this finding was created.

last_seen_time_dt.caption: Last Seen
last_seen_time_dt.description:
The time when the finding was most recently observed. e.g. The time when a vulnerability was most recently observed.

It can differ from the modified_time timestamp, which reflects the time this finding was last modified.

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The time when the finding was last modified.

firewall_rule.caption: Firewall Rule
firewall_rule.name: firewall_rule
firewall_rule.description: The Firewall Rule object represents a specific rule within a firewall policy or event. It contains information about a rule's configuration, properties, and associated actions that define how network traffic is handled by the firewall.

condition.caption: Condition
condition.description: The rule trigger condition for the rule. For example: SQL_INJECTION.

duration.caption: Duration Milliseconds
duration.description: The rule response time duration, usually used for challenge completion time.

match_details.caption: Match Details
match_details.description: The data in a request that rule matched. For example: '["10","and","1"]'.

match_location.caption: Match Location
match_location.description: The location of the matched data in the source which resulted in the triggered firewall rule. For example: HEADER.

rate_limit.caption: Rate Limit
rate_limit.description: The rate limit for a rate-based rule.

sensitivity.caption: Sensitivity
sensitivity.description: The sensitivity of the firewall rule in the matched event. For example: HIGH.

desc.caption: Description
desc.description: The description of the rule that generated the event.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the rule that generated the event.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The rule type.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the rule that generated the event.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

affected_package.caption: Affected Software Package
affected_package.name: affected_package
affected_package.description: The Affected Package object describes details about a software package identified as affected by a vulnerability/vulnerabilities.

fixed_in_version.caption: Fixed In Version
fixed_in_version.description: The software package version in which a reported vulnerability was patched/fixed.

package_manager.caption: Package Manager
package_manager.description: The software packager manager utilized to manage a package on a system, e.g. npm, yum, dpkg etc.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The installation path of the affected package.

remediation.caption: Remediation Guidance
remediation.description: Describes the recommended remediation steps to address identified issue(s).

architecture.caption: Architecture
architecture.description: Architecture is a shorthand name describing the type of computer hardware the packaged software is meant to run on.

cpe_name.caption: The product CPE identifier
cpe_name.description: The Common Platform Enumeration (CPE) name as described by (NIST) For example: cpe:/a:apple:safari:16.2.

epoch.caption: Epoch
epoch.description: The software package epoch. Epoch is a way to define weighted dependencies based on version numbers.

hash.caption: Hash
hash.description: Cryptographic hash to identify the binary instance of a software component. This can include any component such file, package, or library.

license.caption: Software License
license.description: The software license applied to this package.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The software package name.

purl.caption: Package URL
purl.description: A purl is a URL string used to identify and locate a software package in a mostly universal and uniform way across programming languages, package managers, packaging conventions, tools, APIs and databases.

release.caption: Software Release Details
release.description: Release is the number of times a version of the software has been packaged.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The type of software package, normalized to the caption of the type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

1.caption: Application
1.description: An application software package.

2.caption: Operating System
2.description: An operating system software package.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

vendor_name.caption: Vendor Name
vendor_name.description: The name of the vendor who published the software package.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

win_service.caption: Windows Service
win_service.name: win_service
win_service.description: The Windows Service object describes a Windows service.

cmd_line.caption: Command Line
cmd_line.description: The full command line used to launch the service.

load_order_group.caption: Load Order Group
load_order_group.description: The name of the load ordering group of which this service is a member.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The unique name of the service.

service_category.caption: Service Category
service_category.description: The service category, normalized to the caption of the service_category_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

service_category_id.caption: Service Category ID
service_category_id.description: The normalized identifier of the service category.

1.caption: Kernel Mode
1.description: A kernel mode driver.

2.caption: User Mode
2.description: A user mode service.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The service category is not mapped. See the service_category attribute, which contains an event source specific value.

service_dependencies.caption: Service Dependencies
service_dependencies.description: The names of other services upon which this service has a dependency.

service_error_control.caption: Service Error Control
service_error_control.description: The service error control, normalized to the caption of the service_error_control_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

service_error_control_id.caption: Service Error Control ID
service_error_control_id.description: The normalized identifier of the service error control.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The service error control is unknown.

1.caption: Ignore
1.description: The startup program ignores the error and continues the startup operation.

2.caption: Normal
2.description: The startup program logs the error in the event log but continues the startup operation.

3.caption: Severe
3.description: The startup program logs the error in the event log. If the last-known-good configuration is being started, the startup operation continues. Otherwise, the system is restarted with the last-known-good configuration.

4.caption: Critical
4.description: The startup program logs the error in the event log, if possible. If the last-known-good configuration is being started, the startup operation fails. Otherwise, the system is restarted with the last-known good configuration.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The service error control is not mapped. See the service_error_control attribute, which contains an event source specific value.

service_start_name.caption: Service Start Name
service_start_name.description: For a user mode service, this attribute represents the name of the account under which the service is run. For a kernel mode driver, this attribute represents the object name used to load the driver.

service_start_type.caption: Service Start Type
service_start_type.description: The service start type, normalized to the caption of the service_start_type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

service_start_type_id.caption: Service Start Type ID
service_start_type_id.description: The normalized identifier of the service start type.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The service start type is unknown.

1.caption: Boot
1.description: A kernel mode driver loaded at boot.

2.caption: System
2.description: A kernel mode driver loaded during system startup.

3.caption: Auto
3.description: A user mode service started automatically during system startup.

4.caption: Demand
4.description: A user mode service started on demand when a process calls StartService.

5.caption: Disabled
5.description: A driver or service that cannot be started.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The service start type is not mapped. See the service_start_type attribute, which contains an event source specific value.

service_type.caption: Service Type
service_type.description: The service type, normalized to the caption of the service_type_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

service_type_id.caption: Service Type ID
service_type_id.description: The normalized identifier of the service type.

1.caption: Kernel Driver
1.description: A kernel mode driver.

2.caption: File System Driver
2.description: A kernel mode file system minifilter.

3.caption: Own Process
3.description: A user mode service that runs in its own process.

4.caption: Share Process
4.description: A user mode service that shares a process with other services.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The service type is not mapped. See the service_type attribute, which contains an event source specific value.

labels.caption: Labels
labels.description: The list of labels associated with the service.

tags.caption: Tags
tags.description: The list of tags; {key:value} pairs associated to the service.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the service.

raw_data.description: The raw event/finding data as received from the source.

unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The time when the registry key was last modified.

path.caption: Path

security_descriptor.caption: Security Descriptor

data.caption: Data

is_default.caption: Default Value
is_default.description: The indication of whether the value is from a default value name. For example, the value name could be missing.

is_system.caption: System
is_system.description: The indication of whether the object is part of the operating system.

modified_time.caption: Modified Time
modified_time.description: The time when the registry value was last modified.

name.caption: Name
name.description: The name of the registry value.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The full path to the registry key, where the value is located.

type.caption: Type
type.description: A string representation of the value type as specified in Registry Value Types.

99.caption: Other

modified_time_dt.caption: Modified Time
modified_time_dt.description: The time when the registry value was last modified.

win_resource.name: win_resource
win_resource.description: The Windows resource object describes a resource object managed by Windows, such as mutant or timer.

details.caption: Details
details.description: The string detailing the attributes of the resource object.

name.caption: Name

svc_name.caption: Service Name
